loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza D., from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City, is 21 years old, single, and has one infant. To make a living, Meliza owns and operates a specialized retail store selling broomsticks that she makes. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Meliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional materials needed, she is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be Meliza's second loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem S., 54, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$ 1 each day, while her husband is a carpenter making US$ 6 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Khem S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase carpentry tools.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools for her husband

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. María,  es Sacabeña, Nacida en Sacaba Cochabamba, es muy conocida por la zona por la actividad que realiza que es el decorado D. altares para matrimonios, quince años, fiestas religiosas es muy cotizada por la puntualidad, responsabilidad y calidad D. trabajo que ofrece, el préstamo lo destinara para comprar variedad D. telas y floreros D. cristal para centros D. mesa  su objetivo es tener una diversidad D. telas D. colores y adornos  para ofrecer a  las personas que solicitan sus servicios variedad en sus productos, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María is Sacabeña, meaning she was born in Sacaba Cochabamba. She is very well known in the area for the work that she does, which is decorating altars for weddings, 15th birthday celebrations, and religious festivals. She is much sought-after because of her punctuality, responsibility, and the quality of her work. She will use the loan to buy a variety of cloths and glass vases for table centerpieces. Her goal is to have a range of different colored decorative fabrics to offer to the people who request her services. She is very grateful to the institution for the support offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of fabrics and glass vases

loans.name: Mike

texts.en: Mike M. O. is 32 years old, married to a business lady and they have one child, age one and a half years old, whom they hope to educate to the university level. His business is located in an open air market in Nairobi known as Jua Kali and is well known as "Kombewa Workshop". He makes and sells metal boxes, wheelbarrows, chicken feeders, etc., to the local people. He has been doing this business for the last ten years and he says that his business is profitable. He works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. The major challenge Mike has is lack of raw materials to make his end products. Mike is using this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more scrap metal for making metal boxes. He hopes to have a big store with over 20 workmen. He also sees himself having more children and becoming rich in the future. He describes himself as dedicated and a team builder.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Janette is married and has 3 children aged 27, 23 and 22. To make a living, Janette owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Janette works hard to improve her family's living conditions. 

Janette joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Janette has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Janette is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 59-year-old married man who lives with his wife and one child. He has been working as a baker since 2007. His fresh baked goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. He prepares delicious Lebanese breads. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a refrigerator to display his goods. He is planning to continue the expansion of his business and he is positive about the coming year. His bakery is an important source of income for his family. Lebanon has many pastry shops and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase a display refrigerator

loans.name: Luna De Oro Group

texts.es:
LUNA DE ORO

JOSE DAVID C. S.. el tiene 30 años de edad tiene una hija pequeña, el se dedica a la venta de tortillas con carne, y panes con carne, tiene una su carreta, y vende en el mercado, con el apoyo de su esposa obtiene mejores ventas, necesita su credito para poder ampliar su venta de comida y tambien  siembra arveja china.


JULIAN PABLO M. S.. 
el tiene 42 años de edad, el se dedica a la elaboración de puertas ventanales de estructuras
metalicas carretas para venta de comida  y tambien taller de carpintería, el tiene su taller en su casa en la aldea, tiene 4 hijos, los tiene estudiando,nececita el credito para ampliacion de su carpinteria  para poder obtener mejores ventas.

OSCAR DAVID C. S.
tiene 23 años de edad, no tiene ningun hijo es recien casado , el se dedica a la venta de tortillas con carne por las tardes, y tambien a ala agricultura siembre arveja china, su credito lo necesita para ampliar su venta de comida
texts.en:
LUNA DE ORO

JOSE DAVID C. S.. 
Jose, 30, has a young daughter.  He operates a business selling meat wrapped in tortillas or bread.  He has a cart and sells at a local market.  His wife helps him with the business and together they've increased sales.  Jose is applying for a loan so that he can expand the food business with part of the funds and plant peas with the rest.

JULIAN PABLO M. S.. 
Julian, 42, operates a business building parts for food carts.  He's also a carpenter.  Julian has 4 children, all in school, and he's applying for a loan to expand his carpentry business and, in turn, increase his income.

OSCAR DAVID C. S.
Oscar, 23, is recently married.  He works selling meat wrapped in tortillas in the afternoon.  He also grows peas for extra income.  Oscar is applying for a loan to expand his food business.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Husu

texts.en: Husu M., 41, breeds cows and calves in the small village of Sabirabad. He has six years of experience in this field and currently has two cows. This business is only financial source in his family. Husu's son helps him a lot in looking after the animals. He wakes up early in the morning to feed the cattle and pastures them for the rest of the day. He is also very careful about vaccinating them on time. Now, he would like to increase his income and purchase two more cows. This will allow him to improve the lives of his four children.

loans.use: To purchase two more cows.

loans.name: Zaryl

texts.en:
Zaryl K. is 51 years old. She lives in Kochkor village in the north of Kyrgyzstan and has four grown children. Zaryl graduated from college and worked as a cook in the local area for 20 years. She is characterized by her colleagues as a responsible, precise and open-hearted person. Now she is engaged in cattle breeding and makes every effort to provide some savings for old age. 

Zaryl used her starting capital of 2,000 KGS to buy livestock for fattening and reselling. Thanks to her persistent and hard-working personality, she managed to enlarge the number of livestock and earns about 3,000 KGS monthly. With the revenues from livestock reselling, Zaryl was able to build up a barn. 

Zaryl plans to use this loan of 130,000 KGS to buy six bull calves. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to broaden out her business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita O. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and convenience foods in the local community. She also buys and sells vegetables such as eggplants, cabbages and tomatoes. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Mercedita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as convenience foods and canned goods. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as convenience foods and canned goods

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, de 36 años, esta  casado con Elizabeth (35),y  juntos habitan su casa alquilada en compañía de  sus 2 hijos y esta  ubicada en una comunidad  de la selva central peruana.Él  se declara como un  “mil oficios” (trabaja en diversas actividades). Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la agricultura y es  su principal actividad económica durante todos los fines de semana. Se la pasa cuidando de sus cultivos de plátano y café, y aunque siente su cuerpo cansado después de una semana de trabajo arduo igual abona, cosecha y limpia sus cultivos. Su esposa  comercializa los productos en los depósitos de frutas que existen en la ciudad, además trabaja de lunes a viernes como albañil, y  le pagan un promedio de 40 soles diarios. “Trabajando podemos salir adelante”, afirma, es por esta razón que  esta pensando comprar más terrenos agrícolas para sembrar en mayores cantidades para mejorar sus ganancias.Él pertenece al banco comunal “La Palmas”, y es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ha demostrado ser una persona honesta, trabajadora y solidaría.Sus cultivos necesitan de constante abono para poder crecer sin dificultades y tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la  compra de ocho sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Samuel is 36 years old.  He is married to Elizabeth (35) and they live in a rented house with their 2 children in a community in the central Peruvian jungle.  Samuel describes himself as 'a man of a thousand trades' (he carries out several business activities).

Samuel has been farming for 15 years and this is his main business activity every weekend.  He looks after his banana and coffee crops and, although his body is tired after a week of hard work he applies manure to his crops, harvests them and weeds them.  His wife sells products in the fruit warehouses in the city.   Samuel also works as a construction worker from Monday to Friday.  They pay him, on average, 40 Peruvian soles a day.  "We can get ahead working together" he says.  For this reason, Samuel is thinking of buying more farmland to grow in larger quantities so that he can improve his profits.

Samuel belongs to the "Las Palmas" community bank and this is his third loan with MFP.  He has shown himself to be an honest, hard-working and supportive person.  His crops need constant applications of manure so that they can grow without problems and he is planning to spend his money on buying eight sacks of manure.

loans.use: To buy manure to improve his crops

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat lives in Kasur, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its leather industry. She lives there in a small two-room home in the area of Rukn-pura. She is the mother of three sons. All of them are very young and studying in the local school. Farhat herself is a 35-year-old talented lady who operates a clothes sewing business at her home. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and generates income for the family.
 
Her husband's name is M. S. and he has an electronics sales shop. He sells different electronics such as televisions, irons, etc. on installments. He buys products from wholesale markets and then offers the opportunity to his clients to buy those products on installments with interest. He has been operating this business for over eighteen years. 

Farhat has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more items to sell to his clients for profit.  Farhat is very confident that her husband’s business will be improved and that her family's standard of living will become better as a result. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior by paying her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy items like televisions and irons for her husband's business

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven members located in Kokir Thum, Kandal province. All of the members of this group loan will use their portions of the money to support their different purposes. 

Mr. Hak S., born in 1972, was selected as village bank president by its members. He and his wife, Mrs. Brak ChanN., are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow corn and rice to support their family. To sustain the farm, Mr. Hak S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline for growing corn and rice. This couple also earns their living by fishing. They have three children, all students who also help out with their parents' businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and gasoline for growing corn and rice

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad  tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su hijos y su esposo en el caserío Malingas  del distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella tiene una Bar Picantería donD. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas como cerveza y chicha D. jora, además ofrece piqueos y comida. Su negocio tiene una antigüedad D. 5 años aquí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona los días sabados, domingos y lunes. El negocio tiene gran acogida gracias a la buena sazón D. Natividad, esta actividad es D. mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio D. el se encarga D. ayudar al sostenimiento D. su economía familiar.

Natividad desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. su comida y también productos  como cerveza y algunas sillas esto debido a que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Natividad is 46 years old, married, and lives with her children and her husband in the rural Malingas settlement in the TambogranD. district.  This is an agricultural area located in the Piura region, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Natividad has a bar/restaurant where she sells drinks such as beer and chicha D. jora (a traditional Peruvian corn-based beverage), and where she also offers snacks and food.  She has had this business for 5 years, and she sells her products to her neighbors and to the people who come to work in the area on Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays. This business is well received by the public, thanks to the good cooking of Natividad.  This business is a great help to her family, because through it she is able to help support her household.

Natividad wants to expand her business by buying supplies that she needs for food that she prepares, and also products such as beer and new chairs, since the demand for her business is growing.  To do this, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles, which will allow her to achieve this objective.

loans.use: to buy supplies and beer for her business

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia B. is from the village of Tapican, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years old. Rodelia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she provides general services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $94 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rodelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Rodelia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Krech

texts.en: Krech P. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. P. sells used clothes, earning an income of USD 2.6 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 100 on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase more used clothes to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es:
Don Fidel Ángel, es un señor de 40 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a su señora esposa, y sus hijos de 17, 14 y 12 años de edad, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, desde hace 25 años, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días regularmente de 6:00am a 3:00pm, ó también dependiendo de la necesidad en que se encuentre.
Actualmente está en proceso de iniciar una nueva siembra de granos básicos, para lo cual solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en abono  y fertilizantes, con esta compra puede dar un mejor cuido a la siembra y estar al pendiente del crecimiento, el cual espera le de buenos frutos, aunque siempre existen riesgos en este oficio, pues depende de las condiciones del clima los cuales pueden favorecer o dañar el cultivo.
Para don Fidel, el continuar en el trabajo es lo que lo motiva, ya que de él depende su familia y sobre todo la preparación de hijos, de los cuales espera sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Fidel Ángel is a 40 year-old gentleman who lives in San Rafael Oriente, in San Miguel department, together with his wife and children aged 17, 14 and 12.  Fidel has been growing corn and beans for 25 years.  He learned how to farm from his father and works regularly every day from 6.00am to 3.00pm, or longer if need be.

Fidel is currently in the process of sowing a new crop of basic grains.  He is requesting a loan to invest in buying manure and fertilizers.  This purchase will enable him to better care for his crops and take care of their growth.  He hopes to obtain good fruit from his crops.

There are always risks in this business as everything depends on weather conditions which can favor or damage crops.  Fidel is motivated by his desire to continue working since his family depend on him.  In particular, he wants to prepare his children as he hopes that they will become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is currently in the business of selling clothes. She is 46 years old, married, with 7 children, and all of them go to school. Susan borrowed a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to build a house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Bintiomar

texts.en:
Bintiomar is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 
 
For the past 5 years, she has had a farming business, planting maize, which she then sells. She faces a major challenge of bad weather conditions for the maize. She dreams of becoming a reliable supplier of vegetables in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Anabel María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Miraflores, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
Aquí conocimos Anabel, tiene 26 años de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos más pequeños. Está desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.

Ella ayuda a su mamá en los quehaceres del hogar pero además tiene una sociedad con un tío con el cual se dedican a la compra y venta de ciertos productos del campo, ellos comprar arroz, melón, sandia, pepinos y otros productos que se cultivan por la zona donde ella habita, trabajan cinco días a la semana, ellos recorren  la zona recogiendo los productos directamente de los agricultores para luego llevarlos en el carro de su tío hasta la ciudad de Portoviejo específicamente a  los mercados de la ciudad para luego entregar sus productos a pequeños comerciantes que son los que distribuyen  al por menor a los consumidores. Llevan realizando esta actividad por más de seis años y nos cuenta que les va muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, melón, pepinos, sandia y todos los productos del campo que ellos distribuyen.
 
Su sueño es tener un camión más grande para llevar sus productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Miraflores community bank meet in a place known as Los Arenales, in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet 26 year-old Anabel who is single and lives in her parents' home together with her younger siblings.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because you can obtain loans quickly and without too many requirements.

Anabel helps her mom with the housework but also owns a business together with one of her uncles.  They buy and sell certain crops.  They buy rice, melons, watermelons, cucumbers and other crops which are grown in their area.  They work five days a week, traveling round the area, collecting produce directly from the farmers.  They then transport the produce, in her uncle's vehicle, to the city of Portoviejo, specifically to the markets in the city, and deliver their produce to small salespeople who will sell it retail to consumers.  They have been in this business for more than six years and she tells us that it is doing very well.

Anabel will use this new loan to buy rice, melons, cucumbers, watermelons and other produce that they distribute.  Her dream is to own a larger truck so that they can transport their produce to other cities.

loans.use: to buy melons, watermelons, cucumbers, rice and other produce

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 47 años, vive con 2 de sus 4 hijos  en su casa que es propia. Casi toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades  agrícolas, pero hace 16 años empezó con la ganadería, ya que las vacas que posee le proporcionan gran cantidad de leche, que los lleva a vender a una fábrica de lácteos, que se encuentra cerca de su vivienda. Es así que sus vacas producen 60 litros leche diariamente, y por tal recibe buena cantidad de dinero. Por otro lado, vende también los becerros machos, así se genera más ingresos. En ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan en esta actividad, asimismo la apoyan en la siembra de papa y maíz,  pero lo hacen en menos extensiones de terreno, pues lo cosechado es utilizado para su consumo propio. Eva sabe lo rentable que le ha resultado la venta de leche, por ello desea su ayuda con un pequeño préstamo para pueda ampliar su establo y mejorar su infraestructura. Este será su crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto espera de su apoyo para que pueda cumplir sus objetivos, asimismo asegura que será muy responsable en sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de remedios para sus vacas y también semilla de pastizales para sembrar en sus terrenos y tener forraje para alimentar a sus vacas.
texts.en:
Eva is 47 years old and lives with two of her four children in a house she owns. She has been farming almost all her life, but also ventured into the livestock business 16 years ago when she began selling excess milk produced by her cows to a local dairy. Her cows produce 60 liters of milk a day, which generates a lot of income. She also earns revenue from the sale of male calves. 

Occasionally, Eva's children help her with her livestock business and farm. They grow potato and maize, but mostly for the family's consumption. Most of the land is dedicated to the dairy business because it is more profitable. She is applying for a small loan to expand and improve her stables. 

This will be Eva's third loan from MFP and she hopes to again receive the institution's financing. She is able to meet all requirements and will responsibly repay the loan. With the loan capital, Eva will buy medication for her dairy cows as well as grass seed to cultivate pasture land for grazing.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her cows as well as grass seed to plant a pasture for grazing.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a tailor from Ibanda.  He is 41 years old and married with 5 children with 4 of them still in school.  Julius sews and makes clothes with the help of one casual worker and he operates from Katogo Trading Centre.  He is able to generate 250,000 UGX in a week in addition to the sale of produce from his farm. 

He has had the tailoring business for 10 years, working tirelessly to earn a better living.  He is such a god fearing man and this is one reason you will not find his customers complaining of loss of material or unfinished business since he cares a lot.  He needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials, threads and other materials for an expanded business and better service delivery.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials, threads and other materials for an expanded business and better services.

loans.name: Rubí

texts.es:
La señora Rubí es socia del banco comunal Mujeres solidarias del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 50 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Son tres años que viene trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la costura y confección D. prndas, cuenta con un taller bien equipado con 4 máquinas, 2 son industriales.
Con su nuevo préstamo D.  S/. 2,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 kilos D.  tela D. algodón, 12  hilos D.  remalle D. diferentes colores,  ½ litro D. aceite D. maquinas, 4 paños D. aguja, uno para cada máquina.
Su esposo es trabajador independiente y tiene que trabajar bastante para poder traer el dinero a su hogar, D. ahí partió la necesidad D. trabajar ambos para poder solventar los gastos familiares.
Sus hijos todavía son pequeños y necesitan la atención D. sus padres.
Rubí está contenta porque ahora si tiene las herramientas para poder trabajar y elaborar buenos productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Rubí is a member of the "Mujeres Solidarias" ("Women's Solidarity") communal bank in the district of Caleria, department of Ucayali. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for three years. She works sewing and making garments. She has a well-equipped workshop with four sewing machines, two of which are industrial.

She will buy the following with her new loan of 2,200 nuevos soles: 15 kilograms of cotton fabric, 12 bobbins of thread in various colors, 1/2 a liter of machine oil, and four needle cloths (one for each machine)

Her husband is an independent worker and they have had to work a great deal to be able to bring enough money into their house. This is why they both need to work to meet their family's needs.

Her children are still small and need their parents' attention.

Rubí is happy because now if she has the tools she can work and create good products.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and needles

loans.name: Arvie

texts.en:
Arvie is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Arvie has a shop that sells bags. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional bags.  Arvie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Arvie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bags

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 25 years old and single. For the past three years he has had a food shop where he sells snacks like tempura and kikiam.

Anthony is a new member of HSPFI. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tempura and kikiam to sell. In the future, Anthony hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tempura and kikiam to sell.

loans.name: Hameda

texts.en:
Hameda is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married and has four sons and two daughters, Hameda lives in Khan Younis city in Palestine. Hameda's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Hameda is has a backache that is caused by a problem with her spine.  Her husband can't afford to pay for the tests needed to diagnose the problem at once.  Hameda took out a loan from FATEN to cover the cost.

Hameda is a religious conservative woman. Her husband is photographed instead at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To pay for health treatment expenses

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 59-year-old mixed-crop farmer. She is widowed with three adult children, aged 35, 30 and 25. She has been a farmer for the past 20 years with a monthly income of KES 16,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will buy another plot of land for farming. 

Her hope is to buy watering pipes to water her crops to increase the yield from the farm to support herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Eric

texts.es: Este cliente trabaja para Cemex de Nicaragua como operador de equipo pesado tiene cinco años de trabajar para esta empresa, tienen casa propia, el dinero lo solicita para la compra de materiales de construcción arena, cemento y hierro para hacer un baño, se le han financiado dos crédito el primero lo utilizo en hacerle un aumento a su casa, manifiesta que estos crédito le ayudan de mucho ya que solo así puede ir haciéndole mejoras a su casa.
texts.en: This client works for Cemex Nicaragua as a heavy equipment operator.  He has worked for the business for five years.  He has his own home and requests the money to buy construction materials like sand, cement, and iron to build a bathroom.  He has financed two previous loans, the first one he used to build an add-on to his house.  He says that these loans help a lot, since this is the only way he can make home improvements.

loans.use: buy sand, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is 40 years old, married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City.
Quyen and her husband earn money by sewing hats at their house. Quyen intends to use her loan to buy fabric and materials to increase her production. She hopes that her business runs smoothly, and that this will help to improve her family's living conditions and give her the ability to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing materials to increase her production of hats.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme de 22 ans, il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfant.
Koffi  est un revendeur depuis 2010. Il achète et revend pour sa clientèle composée de toutes personnes des cartes de recharges. Il s’approvisionne auprès des sociétés de communication de Lomé. Koffi sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de diverses cartes de recharges
texts.en:
Koffi is 22 years old, single and has no children. 

Koffi has been a small-scale retailer since 2010. He buys telephone recharge cards and retails them to his varied clientele. He buys from communications companies in Lomé. Koffi is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy various sorts of telephone cards.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards.

loans.name: Muungano Oaf Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Muungano OAF Group in Western Kenya! Joab is the facilitator of the Muungano OAF group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joab takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joab had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Joab was only able to harvest 3.5 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joab and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joab will  pay for school fees and other household expenses. In 2012, the members of Muungano OAF group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture, the field officer is featured standing on the left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Unidas Por Siempre Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Unidas por Siempre” es un Nuevo grupo conformado por 08 mujeres emprendedoras dispuestas a trabajar bien con el Programa- Prosperidad. Isela tiene 36 años de edad es separada y tiene 06 hijos en etapa escolar. Isela en el transcurso de su vida se ha dedicado a diversas actividades como a la venta de desayuno, picarones y anticuchos, es así como a sacado adelante a sus hijos, con la ayuda de su ex pareja quien le pasa mantención para sus hijos, también nos manifiesta que inicio un nuevo  negocio de venta de productos de belleza donde obtiene un  ingresos más, esto la beneficia mucho ya que la mayor de sus hijas va a empezar a estudiar en un instituto. El deseo de Isela es que su hija termine la carrera de gastronomía para así poder instalar un restaurante en su domicilio y sabemos que con mucho esfuerzo lo va a lograr. Con el crédito que solicito va a comprar insumos para la preparación de picarones como harina, azúcar y platos donde pueda ofrecer. La Alcancía Comunal “Unidas por Siempre” agradecen la ayuda brindada.  Isela es la que viste un polo manga larga color blanco.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Unidas por Siempre" is a new group comprised of 8 women entrepreneurs willing to work hard in the Programa-Prosperidad.  

Isela is 36 years old, separated and has six school-aged children.  In her lifetime she has had several businesses involving food sales (breakfast, pumpkin fritters, kebabs) and has been able to provide for her children with the help of her ex-partner who pays child support.  She tells us she also has started a new business selling beauty products to earn mO. income.  This is of great help since her eldest daughter will start high school.

Isela's dream is for her daughter to finish her gastronomy studies so she can set up a restaurant at home, and with much effort she hopes to be able to do it.  The loan she has requested is to buy supplies for the pumpkin fritters, such as flour, sugar and disposable plates.  The "Unidas por Siempre" communal bank is grateful for your help.  Isela is the one in the white long-sleeved top.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and disposable plates.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad is married with two children. He sells food items. His grocery store is located in a very busy place, Agsu central bazaar, which is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries. He is a hard worker and works long days to make sure his family has everything they need. Elshad has been running this business for four years. Step by step he was able to expand his small venture. 

Elshad’s business is the only source of income for his family and it is 300 AZN per month. He realizes this responsibility and is doing his best to meet the needs of his family. 

Today he is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase more foods to cover customers demand. Elshad is hoping that from the profit of his business, he can expand his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more foods to sell.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio, de 47 años ; es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Isabel, su esposa desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero vive con 5 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Acocra. Como padre trabajador, todas las mañanas distribuye su tiempo, para realizar las diferentes actividades del día. Durante las mañanas trabaja en una mina de cobre, donde la pagan por jornada diaria, pues tiene que trasladar los minerales. Asimismo coordina junto a su esposa, los cuidados de sus sembríos de papa, olluco y maíz, los cuales realiza con mucha dedicación, pues tiene las ganas de salir adelante. Paralelo a esa actividad se dedican a la ganadería, con las 7 vacas que posee, cuenta que gracias a la leche que le brindan, pueden hacer 2 moldes de queso diarios, que vende a los comerciantes que llegan a su misma casa, como también sus cosechas los comercializa en Acostambo, durante la feria de los días viernes. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Jooc Sanjolla” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Sergió de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa de la variedad “peruanita”.
texts.en:
Sergio, 47, is a hardworking man.  He lives with Isabel, his wife of 7 years.  They have 8 children but only 5 still live with them in his own house located in Acocra.  As a hardworking father he allots his time daily to various activities.  During the morning he works in a copper mine where he earns a daily wage; he works hauling the minerals.  He also coordinates with his wife caring for the potato, olluco [tuber] and corn crops which he does with much dedication because he wants to get ahead.  Parallel to this, they also raise livestock.  With milk produced by the 7 cows he owns they can make two cheese molds daily that are sold to merchants who come to his very house.  The crops are sold in Acostambo during the Friday farmers market.

He belongs to the “Jooc sonjolla” communal bank and this is the first MFP loan where he hopes to get your support to solidify his plans.  He enjoys being part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  If Sergio were to receive your support, he’ll use the requested funds to buy natural fertilizer to spread among his crops of “Peruanita” variety of potato.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Sokhouch

texts.en: Sokhouch, 27, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sokhouch is employed at the factory and her husband is a construction worker. Sokhouchis requesting a loan to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She sells fish for a living. She also makes "tinabal" (salted fish, which is packed in salt in a plastic container for days to age) to sell. Virginia's husband is a fisherman and she also helps in selling his catch at the market.

Virginia has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. Virginia hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials.

loans.name: Darlison

texts.en:
Darlison is a 33-year-old single mother of four children. She sells second-hand clothes and she has been in the business for two years now. She faces a challenge of the business being seasonal. She hopes to expand her business into new markets.

Darlison needs a loan to buy more clothes to sell in order to take advantage of the peak Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es:
La Sra. Dolly es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Alberto hace 26 años, tienen 6 hijos juntos: Mariela, Luis, Nancy, Victor, Natalia y Vitoria.
La Sra. Dolly es una mujer luchadora, ya que su marido el Sr. Alberto trabaja lejos de la ciudad y ella se encarga de cuidar y criar a sus seis hijos, tiene una despensa y venta de minutas hace 5 años, comenta que con el trabajo de su marido no es suficiente para sacar adelante una familia numerosa por eso se pusieron  montar su despensa. Comenzó  poco a poco su negocio y fue creciendo con la ayuda de sus hijos. Su sueño es tener un minimercado para ofrecer mejor servicios a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, harina, azúcar y demás insumos necesarios para poder surtir su local. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Dolly is from the city Coronel de Oviedo. She is 43 and has been married to Alberto for 26 years. They have 6 children: Mariela, Luis, Nancy, Victor, Natalia and Vitoria. Dolly is a fighter. Her husband works far from the city, so she takes charge of the caring and raising of their six children. 

She has run a small grocery store and has sold cell-phone minutes for 5 years. She says her husband’s work was not enough to get such a large family ahead in life, which is why she opened the store. She started the business one step at a time, and slowly grew it with the help of her kids. Her dream is to have a mini market to offer better services to her customers. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase drinks, flour, sugar, and other staples necessary to stock her store. She is thankful to the foundation for the opportunity that it gives her.

loans.use: purchase drinks, flour, sugar, and other staples

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married business lady with two children. She lives in Mombasa, Kenya, and runs a printing shop, a venture that has been in operation for three years. She was previously employed in a type setting business where she saved money and started her own business.

She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a printer. She looks forward to owning a printing press in the future, despite the challenge of some clients not paying on time.

Virginia will use the additional income from this loan to purchase printing papers.

loans.use: To purchase a printer.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 57 years old and lives in Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 
Juliet has a general store and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Koushalya's Group

texts.en:
Koushalya,standing to the right hand side of the photograph is a physically challenged lady living with her husband, two daughters and a son. She is engaged in the activity of weaving handkerchiefs, her younger daughter helps her in weaving it. Her elder daughter works as a tailor in her village. Financial condition of her family is not good because her husband is also a physically challenged person and he is not able to do any kind of work. She brings raw materials like cotton, thread and colors from a dealer and gives back the finished goods to him and in return she gets only the labor cost, which is very less.

Koushalya has a plan to bring raw material directly from the market and sell back the finished product in the market, doing so will increase her income.Koushalya along with her group member has requested for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.She will use her portion of the loan amount for purchasing raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs. 

She has a dream that her daughters get married in a good well settled house and save some money for her family’s future.Koushalya is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with three children and an active member of the group and her church. She is aged 30 years.

She has been selling handicraft and milk for one year and two years respectively. She sells 6.5 litres every day earning USD1.6 and the craft shop brings in about USD.55 per month. The business is growing day -by- day however, cash withdrawals affect it very much.

loans.use: She would like to use this loan for school fees. Monthly loan repayments will not affect her business but rather allow it to grow and build capacity to support her family financial requirements.

loans.name: Ivanka

texts.en: Ivanka T. is 36 years old. She is married with two children. Ivanka has own retail business since 1999. She keeps three shops in the town of Ihtiman and sells fruits and vegetables, foodstuffs, sportswear and industrial goods. Ihtiman is a small town and there are no many shops in it so these three shops are so popular in the town and have lots of customers. Ivanka T. needs a $ 1200 loan which she will use for working capital.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large marking centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Martha A. is a resident of Nkurankanand sells soaps. She is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is however seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: Wants to expand her soap business.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Svetlana S. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 5 years. She has been in business for no less than 20 years. She is married and has 3 children. Svetlana S. asks for $600 loan to increase the assortment of the goods sold to use the profits to renovate her apartment.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Светлана является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 5 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 20 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ей необходимо 600$, для увеличения ассортимента товара, а полученную прибыль потратить на ремонт квартиры.

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa de Jesús S. M. is a hard working woman, an example mother, and a faithful servant of her community who is dedicated to improving her own life despite the weight of the challenges she faces.

As a child, Teresa was not given the opportunity to study. She married at an early ago, thinking she would have help to she wanted, but her situation ended up turning sour and she had to run away to live in a new community. As an adult she re-initiated her studies, and together with her children Teresa completed secondary school at the age of 41.

In 1998, Teresa joined the Community Bank, "De La Amistad," located en the "Nuevo Bolognesi" district of Calleria in the Coronel Protillo province of the Ucayali region of Peru.

When she started as a member of her community bank, Teresa received her first loan from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos from 300 Nuevos Soles (approx. $94). This loan helped her to begin her business and permitted her to purchase local fruits such as cocona, camu, aguaje, and glasses to bottle regional fruit nectars. Nine years later, Teresa is now requesting a loan for 800 soles (approx. $250) that she will use for the production of fruit juices and nectars. She is able to produce between 1 and 1.6 cartons a day, which translates to around 40 cartons a month.

Having finally completed her studies, Teresa is now enjoying the grand satisfaction of having been able to educate her 3 children and provide work for other women such as herself.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

Teresa de Jesús S. M. es una mujer trabajadora, madre ejemplar y fiel servidora de la comunidad, con muchas ganas de seguir adelante pese a las dificultades.

Desde niña no se le dio la oportunidad de estudiar, posteriormente se casa pensando tener apoyo y fue lo contrario, donde tuvo que huir a otro lugar y posteriormente retomar sus estudios juntamente con sus hijos y así concluyó su secundaria a los 41 años de edad.

Desde el año 1,998 integró el Banco Comunal “DE LA AMISTAD” ubicada en el A.H. “Nuevo Bolognesi”, distrito de Calleria, provincia de Coronel Portillo, Región de Ucayali.

Cuando se inicia como socia de este Banco Comunal empezó con un préstamo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles (US$ 94.00 Aprox), esto le ayudó a iniciar el negocio, le permitió comprar frutas como la cocona, camu camu, aguaje y envases para la elaboración de néctar de frutas regionales. Ahora esta recibido un préstamo de S/ 800.00 soles (US$ 250.00 aprox.) con lo que piensa elevar la producción de néctares de 1 caja diaria a 1.6 cajas diarias, eso significaría una producción de 40 cajas mensuales. La gran satisfacción que tiene es haber concluido sus estudios secundarios, educar a sus tres hijos y además que puede dar trabajo a otras mujeres.

loans.use: To purchase materials, and for working capital

loans.name: Julia Lionila

texts.es:
Julia is from Huarochiri – Lima. She is 49 years old and is a single mother with 4 children. She currently lives in Huaraz, in the department of Ancash. She belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” and sells fabrics.

Julia separated from her husband 27 years ago, when her children were young. She began by selling home-made breads from her home. Since that wasn’t enough, she also sold a variety of other things, such as sweets and clothing during the province’s annual patron saint celebrations. She was also a street vendor in Huaraz.

With this income, she was able to educate her children, acting as both father and mother. Eighteen years ago, she began her business selling fabrics. She has faced many difficulties in this business, but she has been able to overcome them and in this way she has been able to get ahead. Her children are now all professionals and they have their own business selling cellular phones.

With her new loan of S./ 1,500.00 (approximately $500.00) from Manuel Ramos, to be paid back in 4 payments, she will buy more fabrics at wholesale price.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia es natural de Huarochiri - Lima, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos. Actualmente vive en Huaraz, en el Departamento de Ancash, pertenece al Banco Comunal "Mujeres de Grandes Retos" y se dedica a la venta de telas. Hace 27 años se separó de su esposo, cuando sus hijos eran pequeños, se inició vendiendo panes de casa en casa, como no era suficiente vendía diferentes cosas como golosinas, ropas en las fiestas patronales de la provincia y en Huaraz fue vendedora ambulante. Con estos ingresos pudo educar a sus hijos como padre y madre a la vez, hace como 18 años inició el negocio de las telas, en este recorrido ha tenido muchas dificultades pero pudo superarlas y de esta manera ha salido adelante, en la actualidad todos sus hijos son profesionales y tienen su propio negocio de venta de celulares. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles (US$ 500.00 aprox. ) pagadero en 4 cuotas, comprará telas al por mayor.

loans.use: To buy fabrics at wholesale price

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
We found Fernanda happily and animatedly cleaning her small restaurant. She works daily from 4 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon with the help of her great friend and niece Benita and her dear husband Fulgencio. Thanks to the delicious dishes that they prepare, they gradually obtained a group of regular diners as customers. The greatest desire of this enterprising mother of five children, two of whom are already independent professionals, is to continue the business’ growth in order to launch her three younger children into a profession.

To realise her wishes, she is asking for a loan to invest in the renovation and repair of her small site and also to buy some kitchen utensils in order to improve the restaurant’s service. She has promised to repay the loan punctually and responsibly within a period of eight months. With the help of your collaborative spirit this enterprising mother will be able to make concrete plans in a very short time.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Encontramos a doña Fernanda, muy alegre y animosa haciendo la limpieza de su pequeño restaurante. Ella trabaja diariamente desde las 4:00 de la mañana hasta las 3:00 de la tarde con apoyo de su gran socia y sobrina Benita y su querido esposo, Fulgencio. Gracias a los deliciosos potajes que preparan fueron obteniendo paulatinamente un séquito de asiduos comensales y el deseo más próximo de esta emprendedora madre de cinco hijos, dos de ellos ya profesionales e independientes es seguir creciendo con este negocio para terminar de brindarles una profesión a sus tres hijos menores.

Para concretar sus deseos solicita un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la refacción y acondicionamiento de su pequeño local y adicionalmente comprar algunos utensilios de cocina para mejorar la atención en su restaurante, así mismo se compromete reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses y promete ser muy puntual y responsable.Con la ayuda de tu espíritu colaborador esta madre emprendedora podrá concretar sus planes en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Rennovation of small restaurant and purchase of kitchen utensils to replace those currently in use.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
With a loan, Rose N. wants to stock improved seeds for the next season, agricultural equipments for her gardeners, and also purchase a big refrigerator to accommodate the perishable items she sells.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To stock more seeds and stock agricultural equipment

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Marciano Gómez is the owner of Tati’s Grocery and Butcher Shop in the San Antonio district in the city of San Ignacio. There he sells goods like pasta, oil, rice, salt, sugar, and bread goods. His store also specializes in meats which used to be his father’s business before he passed away close to five years ago. His mother helps to run the shop and also contributes to the income with her produce from her vegetable garden.

This year Marciano’s younger sister finishes high school and will be able to help with the family business. However, until then Marciano is asking for a loan to help the business. With the loan he will by cattle vaccines for the animals they are raising for slaughter along with other materials to keep the cattle healthy and ready to sell.

loans.use: To buy animals, vaccinations, and feed for their butcher shop.

loans.name: Zinat

texts.en:
R. Zinat is 49 years old. She is married with two children. 

Zinat sells fruit. She purchases the fruits in the central market of Khujand city at wholesale prices and sells them in Asht region, which is located in a remote area.  Zinat has been in this business for 7 years and has obtained the suppliers as well as the customers. The business is successful and generates the considerable income allowing the family to improve living conditions.

Zinat had been provided with several loans by IMON and had proved herself as an honest and reliable client. Today she requests $800.00 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. Zinat is planning to purchase various fruits in order to enlarge the range of goods for sale. She promises to be accurate and precise in the loan management and payment.

loans.use: Purchasing more fruits in order to expand the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mrs. Sean D., 35, is a mother of four children and works as a construction worker with a daily revenue of two dollars per day. Her husband, Mr. Kret Sean, 34, works as a chief of construction workers building houses. He earns around five dollars a day. Two of their children are students and the others are too young to attend school.

This couple is requesting a loan (to combine with their savings) to purchase lumber so they may repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase lumber for house repairs

loans.name: Aníbal

texts.en:
At the age of 16 Anibal started working in an auto repair shop with his uncle where he began learning how to repair and maintain cars and motorcycles. Over the years, he gained a lot of experience. Now, Anibal is 28 years old and runs his own repair shop. Since he started his business four years ago, Anibal has become well known for the excellence of his work, and he now has a large number of customers.

Anibal dreams of having his business and his house in the same place. He has been saving money in order to buy a property where we could both work and live. The money from the loan would be used to help Anibal’s dream come true.

loans.use: To buy property for a joint house-workshop

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua D. prepares food for sale and also sells other food items. She is married and has 2 children. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase production and sales. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy more food items.

loans.use: To buy more food items to produce and sell

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Seam S., 29, drives a motorcycle-taxi, earning approximately $5 per day. His wife grows crops on the farmland behind her house and earns approximately $3 per day from the sale of her crops. They have three children, all of whom are not yet of age to attend school. The family lives in Dondeav Village, Siem Reap Province.

Mr. S. is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a new motorcycle for his taxi service. He hopes that the motorcycle that he purchases with the loan will enable him to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for his taxi service

loans.name: Thelma Lucrecia

texts.es:
Mrs. R. has more than 7 years' history with the Leon 2000 Foundation. All of her credits have been put towards the purchase of raw materials related to her tailoring shop, she being a fashion designer. She lives in her own house that she has also remodelled with the help of past credits. She is married and has 7 children, two of which are still dependents and one is afflicted with Down's Syndrome.  These are the only children left in her charge.  Her husband is a bus driver, owner of his own vehicle, and he helps economically.

In her small tailoring shop she emplioys two individuals and they work from home.

She offers her services to a steady clientele, already established and to whom she delivers merchandise or the finished products. Her sales are carried out in cash or on credit, of which she collects 50% within 45 days.

Her dreams have mostly materialized in seeing her children become professionals, and work for themselves. Her biggest concern is of her daughter who is differently abled who will be left alone when she passes away. She doesn't feel that the care she provides her now will be the same type of care that she will receive from one of her siblings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora R. tiene mas de 7 años de trabajar con fundación leon 2000, todos su creditos han sido para la compra de materia prima relacionaados con su taller de costura siendo ella modista, vive en casa propia, que tambien con los creditos ha vendido mejorando, es casada, tiene siete hijos de los cuales dos aún dependen de ella uno estudia en la universidad cursa el tercer año en administración de empresa y su otra hija quien le nacio con problemas de SINDROME DE DAUNW ( mentales), siendo los unicos hijo a su cargo.
Su esposo es transportista dueño de una unidad, quien le ayuda economicamente.

En su pequeño taller de costura se genera fuentes de empleo para dos personas dierctamente ya que estás trabajan en su casa.

Ella ofrece sus servicios a clientes fijos, ya establecidos a quienes les entrega mercadería o producto terminado, sus ventas son de contado y credito en un 50 porciento que recupera en un plazo de 45 dias.

Su sueño en su mayoria se han concretizado ya que la mayoria de sus hijos ya son profesionales, y trabajan por su propia cuenta, su mayor pesar es dejar a su hija con capacidades diferentes sola una vez que ella fallezca porque considera que el cuido que ella le da no se la van a dar sus otros hermanos.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi P. is a businessman from Nikopol, Ukraine, where he rents a small facility to manufacture furniture for sale and offer furniture repair/upholstery services. Vitalyi is very hard-working. He has been working really hard for two years and presently he has about $4000 in inventory. 

Vitalyi is seeking a loan of 5000 Grivnas to purchase raw materials and fabric for his business. We believe that his hard work and common sense, in combination with financial assistance, will help Vitalyi achieve his goals and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and fabric for his furniture business

loans.name: Adzowa

texts.fr: Madame A. Adzowa est née le 07 juillet 1958 à Kpalimé ville située à 120 Km de Lomé. Elle est mariée et a 8 enfants à charge. Elle a ouvert un pressing qu’elle a nommée « LAVAGE A SEC LA CONFIANCE ». Depuis qu’elle a commencé cette activité, elle n’a cessé de recevoir la visite de bon nombre de clients car elle maîtrise et fait bien son travail. Les machines qu’elle utilise sont actuellement en panne et elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acquérir une machine à laver et un fer à repasser.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adzowa A. was born on July 7, 1958 in Kpalimé, a town situated about 120 km from Lomé. She is married and has 8 children for whom she is responsible. She has opened a cleaners that she calls "Confidence Cleaners".

Ever since she opened up this business, she has not ceased to have plenty of customers since she is very good at her work. The machines she uses are presently broken and she is requesting this first loan to acquire a washing machine and an iron.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a washing machine and an iron

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chem L. is a farmer in Prey Kduoch Village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Kan Kea, is a construction worker who can only make a small income to support his family. In the business, he now faces a problem because he does not have enough construction tools so his wife has decided to ask for a loan to buy those tools for her husband's work.

Mrs. Chem L. is 25 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of one year old. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy construction tools for her husband

loans.name: Elhadji Ali Ndiaye

texts.fr: Ce garçon de 28 ans est sans femme il habite la maison familialle. son pricipale activité est l 'aviculture .Il dispose d'un poulaillet dans  la maison où il éléve des poulets depuis deux (02)ans .il a obtenu plusieurs prets de la caisse pour son activité.Pour renforcer son  activité par l 'achat de quantite importante de poussins et doubler sa capacite de production,il sollicite un pret.
texts.en:
This 28-year-old boy is without a wife and lives in his family's house. His main business is raising poultry. He has a hen house at home, where he has been raising hens for two years. He has obtained several bank loans for his work. To bolster his business through purchasing sizable quantities of chicks and doubling his production capacity, he is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Patron San Salvador De Pucyura Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal patron san salvador de Pucyura, esta conformada por 13 socias, 10 mujeres y 03 varones.
El distrito de Pucyura se encuenta en la provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
las socias se didican al comercio de productos agricolas, papa, maiz, cereales y comercio de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos), el comercio minorista en los principales mercados funciona de la siguiente manera, las socias compran productos y lo revenden en las principales ferias de la provincia de Anta y en la feria sabatina de productos de los dias sabados en la ciudad del cusco,obteniendo de esta manera pequeños margenes de comercializacion.
El banco comunal se encuentra en el V-ciclo, fue fundado en nov del año 2002, las socias valoran el credito porque incrementa su capital de trabajo y las socias pueden comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderia y de esta manera obtener mejores margenes de ganancia. conjuntamente con el credito el ahorro es de mucha importancia para las socias.
texts.en:
The cooperative bank Patron San Salvador de Pucyura is comprised of thirteen members, ten women and three men. The Pucyura district is located in the Anta province of the Cusco region, about 30 minutes outside the city of Cusco itself. The members dedicate themselves to the sale of various agricultural products such as potato, corn, grains, as well as of small animals (guinea pigs, chickens, pigs). Retail sales in the principal markets of the area works in the following manner: the members purchase their products and resell them in the major markets of the Anca province, as well as at the market that takes place each Saturday in the city of Cusco. In this manner, they obtain a small measure of commerce. The cooperative bank is in its fifth year, having been founded in November of 2002. The members value the credit because it allows them to access working capital and they can purchase greater quantities of merchandise to increase their incomes. Together with the credit, saving is very important to the members.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products to sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús H. S. tiene 58 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II  y vive en la calle Sucre 575 del Puerto Marítimo Salaverry de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo económico de sus padres. Se casó de 20 años  y del feliz matrimonio nacieron  6 hijos que ya están casados.
Su negocio consiste en hacer y reparar redes de pesca, también hace trabajos de artesanía, su trabajo se sujeta a la época, todas estas actividades las realiza en su casa.
El primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en comprar material para hacer artesanía.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en insumos para la confección y reparación de redes.
A Teresa le gustaría comprar una cámara refrigeradora para transportar pescado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa de Jesus H. S. is 58 years old, belongs to the Community Bank of Entrepreneurs II, and lives at 575 Sucre St., Salaverry Seaport, in the province of Trujillo, which is in the La Libertad region of Peru. She completed primary school, but couldn’t study any more because her parents couldn’t afford it. She has been married for 20 years and has six children who are already married, too. Teresa is in the business of making and repairing fishnets. She also makes handcrafts. Because all her work is done from home, she is able to make her own schedule. Teresa paid off her first loan of 300 soles in only four instalments; she used it to buy crafting materials. With this loan of 800 soles, which she plans to repay in only six instalments, she’ll invest in tools for making and repairing nets. Teresa would also like to buy a portable refrigerator for transporting fish.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tools for making and repairing fishnets

loans.name: Thavin's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thavin T. is the group leader of five, who all live in Ta Reab Doun Sar village in Kandal province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Keo Sophary, is employed in a casino club. Even though they try to work hard, they don't earn enough income to support their household. In order to improve their living, Mrs. Thavin T. decided to ask for a loan to buy phone boxes to start a phone service provider.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy phone box to start a phone service provider.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Mr  Kokou ATTISO est né le 05 /02/1970 à Agbélouvé (P/Zio).Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants,il est chauffeur de profession. Activité qu’il exerce tant bien que mal dans son village avec son vieux camion servant à la fois de transport de passagers et de marchandises. Actuellement le véhicule est très  fatigué et l’handicape sérieusement dans son travail .Il veut éviter les difficultés énormes auxquelles il s’expose ; c’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement qui lui permettra d’acheter un nouveau camion de transport pour redonner confiance aux passagers et assurer leur sécurité. Les revenus tirés serviront à veiller au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou Attiso was born on February 5, 1970 in Agbélouvé (Zio Prefecture). Married and the father of 5 children, he is a professional driver, a business he works at as best he can in his village, with his old truck which serves to transport both passengers and merchandise. At present, the vehicle is pretty much worn out and is a serious handicap in his work. He wants to avoid the enormous difficulties he is facing, and that is why he requested a loan to buy a new truck to restore confidence among his passengers and keep them safe. The income from this will help him to see to the welfare of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing a new truck

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
La señora San Juana labora para un restaurante de la ciudad, su esposo el Sr. Saúl labora para una constructora como albañil. 
Ella esta solicitando este crédito para pagar la diferencia de Infonavit para poder obtener su casita y adquirir un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
San Juana works in a restaurant in the city. Her husband, Saúl, works as a mason for a builder. She is seeking this loan to pay the difference to Infonavit [a home loan company] to buy their house and acquire family property.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire a home

loans.name: Albert Lika

texts.fr: Monsieur Albert Lika T. est un barman sis au quartier Mbour 1 de Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Il est marié et a démarré son activité par ses propre fonds.  Il a sollicité ce prêt pour renforcer son activité à fin de pouvoir faire face aux fêtes de Pacques.  L’activité consiste a l’achat et revente de boissons alcoolisées.  Les revenus lui permettent de bien vivre avec sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Albert Lika T. is a bartender located in the Mbour 1 district of Thiès, a city situated 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal. He is married and started his business with his own funds. He requested this loan to bolster his business in response to the Easter holidays. His work consists in buying and reselling alcoholic drinks. The revenues enable him and his family to live decently.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alcoholic drinks for resale

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for three women who live in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. 

Mrs. Sem E., age 30, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. She is married but has no children. Her husband is Sokhom, age 41, who works as a military policeman.

Mrs. E. currently sells groceries out of her home. As another income source, she provides small loans with specific terms to the villagers. Because the business of selling groceries is an important source of the family's income, E. is requesting a loan in order to increase the inventory.

The other two borrowers are: S., a widow who works as a garment worker. She is requesting a loan to buy fruit to sell. K., who sells cakes in her home and needs a loan to purchase ingredients and some groceries to sell.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her grocery  busines

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
By her own initiative, when Adolat was 23 she learned how to make traditional dresses using a sewing machine. This activity has made it possible for her to contribute to her family's income and satisfactorily meet the most urgent needs of her two small children. Every item of clothing Adolat produces is superior, and due to this her orders have markedly increased. She has some very large orders that would be impossible to fulfill if she didn't have an assistant. Her incredible energy, fortitude, and commitment to her clients drives her to offer them new and improved service. To this end, Adolat wants to speed up her dress production by purchasing more fabrics. To accomplish her objective, she is asking for a $500 USD loan to buy new modern fabrics and she promises to repay the loan in 12 months. With your help, you can make her dream come true. Adolat thanks you for your generous contribution.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
