Alma Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alma Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks for sale

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es: La Sra. Dina  es divorciada, tiene 2 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Somos Impacto 2006” grupo  conformado por 8  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Dina trabaja desde hace  30 años en la venta de anticuchos, pancita y menú, este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio,  ya que ella tenía que trabajar para mantener a sus 2  hijos  y es así que empezó vendiendo en la puerta de su casa anticuchos con el tiempo se hizo más conocida y  empezó a tener mayor cantidad de clientes con el tiempo su negocio fue creciendo y es así que obtuvo mayores ingresos y empezó a construir su casa, hoy en día alquila su casa y sigue vendiendo anticuchos y menú,  Dina  nos cuenta que todo lo consiguió con mucho trabajo y perseverancia ya que su motivación eran sus hijos y sus deseos de superación eran más grandes que sus problemas,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, su hijos ya son adultos  y ambos han puesto una empresa de confección de ropa, y sobre todo ella cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida , con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar  insumos, carnes y condimentos  , Sabemos que Dina  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Dina has been selling kebobs, “pancita” (grilled pig stomach) and daily meals for 30 years.   This business emerged as a result of her divorce.  She had to work to support her two children.  That is how she started selling kebabs at the doorway of her house.  In time she became more well-known, and she started to have more customers. 

In time her business was growing, she got greater income, and she started building her house.  Now she rents her house and continues selling kebobs and meals.  Dina tells us that everything she obtained was with much work and perseverance.  Her children were her motivation, and her desire to improve was bigger than her problems.  

Thanks to her effort and dedication she managed to improve her income.  Her children are now adults, and both of them have established a business making clothes.  Above all, she tells us that she has a better quality of life.

In order to continue growing she has requested a new loan to buy supplies, meat, and condiments.  We know that Dina will reach her goals with a lot of work, effort, and the loans that Edaprospo helps her with.

loans.use: to buy supplies, meat, and condiments.

loans.name: Munduru

texts.en:
Munduru is a 22-year-old, married woman with one child who is in school. Munduru has had a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for two months.

Munduru is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase beans and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: De Confianza Los Cerritos Group

texts.es: El Banco De Confianza Los Cerritos está conformado por 8 integrantes en el cual formaron este grupo de  emprendedores que luchan por seguir sus metas y objetivos de crecer con el negocio y en lo personal. La actividad económica de estos integrantes  de grupo son diferente. La señora Juana Francisca es una emprendedora exitosa, ella se dedica a la venta de pan, tortas y cosa de horno toda la vida ha luchado para salir adelante y brindarle a sus hijos una vida mejor. Juana Francisca desde hace tiempo está trabajando con Fundación León 2000, ahora está nuevamente solicitando financimiento para invertir en el negocio para esta temporada navideña que las ventas son buenas lo cual comprara materia prima y poder realizar las elaboración de la cosa de horno.
texts.en: The De Confianza Los Cerritos Communal Bank has 8 members. This group of entrepreneurs are fighting to reach their goals and grow, both personally and as businesspeople. Each member has a different business. Señora Juana Francisca is a successful entrepreneur. She sells bread, pies, and cosa de horno [buns, empanada and rosquilla]. She has worked hard all her life to succeed and offer her children a better life. Juana Francisca has worked with the Fundacion Leon 2000 for some time now. She is now requesting a loan to invest in her business for the Christmas season while sales are good. She will use this loan to buy basic ingredients for making cosa de horno.

loans.use: to buy basic materials to make cosa de horno.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 45 years old, married and blessed with two sons who are already working. She runs a cosmetics shop and she has been in business for 6 years and right now her monthly income from the business is Kshs 35,000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET LTD in the amount of Kshs 30,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her business. Some of the items she plans to restock include hair oils, skin lotions and nail polish. She plans to do farming with the anticipated profit from the business.

loans.use: To add stock to the business.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Nguyen, 63, is a married man and has three children: one son and two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife support their family by running a general store in front of their house. 

Nguyen started this business seven years ago. He sells medicinal oil and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products to stock his store and better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products to stock his store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, shoes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes, clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, clothes.

loans.name: Kiwanuka

texts.en:
Kiwanuka M. is a talented young artist working as an active member of Life in Africa. He joined LiA as an artist and he quickly earned the respect of the other members who elected him the Manager of the WE Center during the last elections. He is a man full of ambitions and talent and he is ready to see his visions come true.

His dream is to start a custom framing workshop near LiA so that customers who buy unframed artpieces can be able to get them framed at reasonable costs.

He has hired a room in the neighbourhood of the LiA Center to operate his custom framing services. He will in this way be able to monitor his business as well as his duties at LiA. This business will provide him with the additonal income he needs to further his own artistic talents.

To launch this project he is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to purchase the necessary equipment. He will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

He has the following budget below to do his work.

Wood saw Manual------50,000

Wood saw Electric--------200,000

Nails 3kgs--------10,000

Glass-------------80,000

Glass cutter----- 10,000

Mounting paper----100,000

Ply wood --------20,000

Mounting paper cutter------20,000

Vanish---------10,000

Wood/ frame panels-----100,000

Rent 4 months----------200,000

Giving a total of Ushs. 800,000

His monthly income is Ushs. 670,000 and his surplus after his monthly expenses is Ushs.270,000, he wants to pay his loan in 10 months at a rate of Ushs. 93,333.

WE Team to benefit: Advertising and marketing

loans.use: Setting up a Customs Framing work shop

loans.name: Kreema

texts.en:
Kreema is 63 years old with her 8 children's living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Kreema who has share business with her daughter jamela at home, they are sewing the neighborhoods clothes.

She already finished the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th loan cycle with positive result now she is continuing with 5th loan cycle through AFSG.

She too loan to buy cotton, new machine, fabric, Generator to increase there business and she can find a income that she can pay the house rent and buy foods for her house.

loans.use: To buy Cotton, Fabric, New muchine

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large marking centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Comfort A. S. is a resident of Nkurankan and sells dry maize in bags. She is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is however seeking a Kiva loan of $750.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian has a metal shop where he works with metal (windows, doors, curtains, drawers, and others). His wife helps him and he also has two employees to whom he pays per work finished and one helper on salary. His shop is located in the cross roads of the village of San Antonio in the city of La Paz and his home is located in the street 13 de Junio # 28 on the same area. This is the second time he requests a loan. And his history with our institution indicates his first loan was paid in time and qualifies him as client 0, which means excellent payment of the loan. The amount requested is to buy raw material (iron bars, rounded and straight, electrodes). His previous records and his work qualify him to access this credit, because of experience in his business, which gives him income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Lubowa

texts.en:
Lubowa is a young man aged 21. He has only his father, who never helped his family with education or start-up capital for business. Lubowa is in a motorcycle transport business in which one motorcycle is cycled among three people in a week. This creates wasted time and hence luck of funds for necessities.

Lubowa is therefore requesting $1200 to purchase his own motorcycle that will be repaid in ten months. This will be his full-time employment. He hopes to save money to buy a plot of land for his home development.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle

loans.name: Marlon Francisco

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Marlon and I'm a micro-business owner. I rely on my income from a small pastry shop in the center of the city where I live. I have several years of experience at this and the business generates income for my family and other commitments. Thanks to this business, our children can go to school and, in their spare time, do other things.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Marlon, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una micro empresa de reposteria, ubicada en el Centro de mi Ciudad, tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos. Gracias a este negocio nuestros hijos pueden estudiar y tambien colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: Buy sugar, flour, eggs, margarine, butter and packing materials for pastry business.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness is a 46-year-old mother of five and a resident of Yombo-Vituka in Dar es Salaam. She keeps poultry at her home, a business she has been doing for the past seven years. She keeps both broilers and layers. She is in need of $725 to help her expand her stock and get ready for the Christmas season.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossy N. operates a telephone service. She wants a loan to purchase more airtime and telephones to increase her business.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase airtime and phones

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 31 year old single mom with a four year old daughter who is just about to begin kindergarten. She lives with her parents and brothers in order to save money. She was in the third year in school on her way to an accounting degree when she had to drop out due to financial difficulties. It is one of her dreams to one day go back to school to gain her degree.

With nowhere else to turn, she got a job working with her father in a spare auto parts shop. She didn’t know anything about the business since she was being formally trained in accounting, and the years she worked with him were hard.

Eventually she picked up the trade and with her skills in numbers and accounting, she became a fine business woman. She had herself and her daughter to support, and did not want to rely on her parents any longer. Recently she decided to venture out on her own and begin her own shop in another area of Paraguay. Both her parents and her brother felt is was a great idea and encouraged her.

Now it has been close to two years since she began her spare parts store and it has grown quite popular in the area. She remembers she was a little scared in the beginning because she did not have much knowledge about owning her own business, however she excelled. Her dedicated clientele says that she has good prices and even better quality of merchandise. Vilma is asking for a loan today to help her purchase more car parts for her shop so that it may continue to grow.

loans.use: To buy car parts.

loans.name: Kabumbi V A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Juliet N.. She is currently in the business of selling fresh food and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Juliet is 32 years old and is married. Her Husband is a taxi driver. She has 8 children ranging from age 3 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Juliet makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Juliet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in the fresh food business and the loan was paid back on time.

Juliet is joined in her small group by Birungi B., Mariam N., Joyce N., and Zam N.. Birungi B. has a business in tailoring and wants to purchase more cloth materials. Mariam N. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Joyce N. operates a business of selling fresh foods and wants to boost business. Zam N. is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling.

loans.use: To expand fresh food business and increase profits

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun S., 53, grows corn on a plot of her farmland. She earns approximately two dollars a day. Her husband, Mr. Veong Vong, 59, supplements the household as a government officer in the village, making less than one dollar a day. The couple has six children, four who are married and live outside the family home.

Mrs. S. would like to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and to renovate the family home.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to renovate the the family home

loans.name: Carita De Arcilla Group

texts.es:
Making yogurt, cheeses, and ice cream is the main activity of the "Carita de Arcilla" (Face of Clay) association, which is made up of 16 women, who are sure to triumph in their businesses. They start their days very early. They first leave food cooked for their families and then dedicate themselves to making cheeses, yogurt, and exquisite handmade ice cream. They say that with better training in terms of sales and distribution of their products, they could sell them in larger quantities. This is why they need a credit to improve the quality of their products in terms of the packaging, presentation, and distribution. This way they will be able to sell more and to improve their income for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La elaboración de yoghurt, quesos y helados es la actividad principal de la asociación “Carita de Arcilla” formada por 16 mujeres, seguras de triunfar en sus negocios. Ellas empiezan su día muy temprano, primero dejan sus alimentos cocinados para la familia y luego se dedican a la elaboración de quesos, yoghurt y exquisitos helados artesanales. Afirman que con una mejor capacitación en cuanto a la venta y distribución de estos podrían vender mayores cantidades de sus productos, es por eso que necesitan crédito para mejorar la calidad de estos en cuanto a empaques, presentación y difusion de sus productos, de esta forma, al vender mas mejoran sus ingresos, para el bien de sus familias.

loans.use: Capital to purchase supplies and also to pay for professional courses

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with grown kids. She runs a business selling children’s toys and other items in the central mall of Kahovka. When Tatyana started her business thirty years ago, she couldn’t find a decent job and had to find other ways to support her family. Today she has about $2000 in turnover capital and makes about $400 net profit per month.

Tatyana is hoping to keep her business running successfully and support her family. It is the only source of income for her family, and she is ready to work hard to overcome daily challenges in order to provide a better livelihood for them. We believe that, with her vision and determination to see things through and aim at success, Tatyana will see all her dreams come true.

loans.use: To increase her income

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Peng H., 36, is married with three children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been a rice dealer since 2004. She goes from house to house to collect rice until she has a large stock of rice to resell at the market. She earns approximately $4 each day. Her husband is a construction worker that builds houses.  He sometimes has to go out of the village to find construction work. On average, he makes $5. One child is a construction worker like his father.

Peng’s husband would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to commute to work and also run a motor-taxi business whenever he has time off from construction.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kun H. lives in Kraing Kantrol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farm worker who tills soil for a living. Mrs. Kun H. is 49 and a widow with two children who are employed in a garment factory.

Even though Mrs. Kun H. and her children are employed, they still live in an old house. Thus she is requesting a loan to build a new house for her family in order to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to build a new house for her family in order to improve their standard of living.

loans.name: Akueté

texts.fr:
Mr N. Akueté est née à Gunoukopé en 1954. Résidant à Kpémé, il est marié et père de 04 enfants. En plus de ses derniers il a 04 personnes à charges. Mr N. exerce le métier de couturier depuis 30 ans. LA concurrence et  l’abondance de friperie ont réduit considérablement sa clientèle. 
     
Aujourd’hui il arrive difficilement à s’occuper de sa famille. Aussi, décida t-il de diversifier son activité. 
      
Il aimerait avoir un crédit pour se lancer dans la production et la vente de pommade médicinale. Cela lui permettra  d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr N. Akueté was born in Gunoukopé in 1954. He lives in Kpémé, is married and the father of four children. He is also caring for four other persons. Mr N. has been a designer/tailor for the last 30 years, but competition and abundance of second hand clothes has considerably reduced his clientele. Currently, he is having difficulties caring for his family. Therefore, he is looking to diversify is job. He would like to have a loan in order to begin production and sales of natural medicines such as creams. This will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of natural medicines (creams)

loans.name: Vianca Vanessa

texts.es:
La señorita Vianca pertenece al Banco Comunal La Lupuna, ubicado en la Av. Guillermo Lumbrera Mz.B Lt.14 AA.HH Las Begonias, distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00, decide invertir en el arreglo de su copiadora. Trabaja 2 años con Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa, estudió enfermería y está realizando sus prácticas profesionales. Usualmente se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con sus responsabilidades.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 paquete de aceite, 1 caja de leche chica y grande, 2 paquetes de fideos y otros.

Vianca es una señorita que lucha por la vida, además está muy agradecida al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que le brinda y gracias a ello se hizo una mujer independiente.
texts.en:
Miss Vianca belongs to the “La Lupuna” community bank, located in Mz B Lt 14 AA. HH Guillermo Lumbrera Ave, Las Begonias, district of Yarinacocha, Ucayali. She is 23 years old and single. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of $100 US (S/. 300), she decided to invest it in fixing her photocopier. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Currently, she has a genetal store in her house, she studied nursing and is currently doing her professional internship. Usually, she gets up really early to carry out her responsibilities. With this loan of $575 (S/. 1,700) which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 1 sac of rice, 1 package of oil, 1 small and 1 large boxes of milk, 2 packages of pasta and other items. Vianca is a young lady that fights for life, she is also very thankful with the community bank of Manuela Ramos for the help provided because it allowed her to become an independent woman.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, milk, pasta and others

loans.name: Klout

texts.en: Klout S., 41, is married and lives with one child and her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is one of the vendors who works selling groceries in the village, making around US$7 in revenue. Her husband, Moeun Thol, 55, works in construction and normally makes US$5 per day. Klout would like to ask for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida tiene 59 años, se quedo viuda hace 5 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y dos yernos que le apoyan. Es ama D. casa, se dedica al cuidado D. sus hijos, en su misma vivienda ha visto por conveniente hacer una granja D. cuyes, pero tiene una dificultad granD., la falta D. espacio para las jaulas. Por el momento los criá en dos jaulas, que por supuesto no se sienten cómodos los cuyes, a la vez siembra papa en chacras temporales para su consumo. Cada día a las 6.00am se va a comprar alfalfa al mercado, por paquetes le cuesta cada uno a S/7 invirtiendo a diario solo en pasto S7.14. Le gusta esta actividad, porque cada cuy lo venD. D. 10 a 12 soles. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero va comprar un terreno que está a su costado para que ahí pueda ampliar  y mandar a construir sus jaulas, ese terreno le va costar S/.1.200.
texts.en:
Alida is a 59-year-old woman who was widowed 5 years ago. She lives with her 5 children and two sons-in-law, who support her. She is a homemaker who takes care of her children in her home. She found it convenient to make a guinea pig farm, but her biggest difficulty is a lack of space for the cages. For the moment, she raises her guinea pigs in two cages, which of course is uncomfortable for them. She also grows potatoes in temporary farms for her consumption. Every morning at 6:00 am, she goes to the market to buy alfalfa in packs, which cost 7.00 PEN each. She invests 7.14 PEN daily in fodder alone. She likes this business because she sells each guinea pig for 10 to 12 PEN. This is her first loan with MFP. With this money, she will purchase a neighboring plot of land so that she can expand her business and have more cages maD.. This plot will cost 1,200.00 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plot of land for guinea pig farm

loans.name: Vilma Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Vilma Rosa  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su octavo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Terminar de repellar la casa), trabaja como docente de Educación primaria en la colonia caracito  desde hace 9 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 9 añitos de edad, a pesar que ella no recibe  ayuda del padre de su hija, no le ha faltado lo basico a su hija, la niña estudia su segundo grado de Educación primaria;  Vilma es una mujer que  se caracteriza por ser humilde en su labor de trabajo, es de escasos recursos económicos pero muy responsable con sus compromisos, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así  ayudar a su madre, a sus hermanitos y a su hija, ya que ella asume en parte con los gastos familiares de su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma Rosa is requesting financing for her eighth loan, to invest into making improvements to her home (to finish plastering). She has worked as a primary school teacher in the Caracito colony for the past nine years. She is the single mother of a 9-year old daughter and, despite the fact that she doesn’t receive any support from the father, she has made sure that her child doesn’t lack any of the basic necessities. Her daughter is in her second year of primary school. Vilma is a woman characterized by being humble in her work and having scant financial resources, however she is very responsible with her commitments. Her dreams include having a home that is in better condition and stable employment so she can help out her mother, brothers and daughter, as she assumes partial responsibility for the family’s living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster her house.

loans.name: Rusmeri

texts.es:
Rusmeri es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Rusmeri es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Rusmeri se dedica a la agricultura de verduras en sus tierras de la comunidad de Compañía, que se ubica a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado Nery García Zarate. Además Rusmeri tiene 4 carros que realizan transporte a diferentes distrito para lo cual tiene chóferes.
Rusmeri necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semilla y abono.
Rusmeri sueña con comprar un carro grande para transportar sus productos y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Rusmeri is a member of Banco Comunal Desarrollo (‘Development Community Bank’). She is 24-years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. Rusmeri grows vegetables on her land in the town of Compañía, 45 minutes from Ayacucho city. She sells her produce in the Nery García market. She also has 4 cars with hired drivers to take the vegetables to different districts. Rusmeri needs a loan of 600 PEN to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She dreams of buying a larger car to transport her products and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Мирзошарифова Шаъмигуль проживает в районе Гиссар. Возрас 25 лет, замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Кроме них самих с ними живут родители мужа. Семья большая и им с мужем приходится много работать для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Поэтому уже 3 года она работает на рынке. Торгует продуктами питания. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы сдеать товарный запас продуктов с длительным сроком хранения. Это поможет ей реже выезжать за товаром , а так же сохранять цены на данный товар.
texts.en:
Shamigul M. lives in Gissar region. She is 25, married, and has one child. Her in-laws live together with Shamigul's family. This is a big family, and Shamigul and her husband work hard to provide for it. For 3 years, Shamigul has been selling food at a local market. She plans to use this loan to create a reserve of non-perishable goods. Having the reserve will help Shamigul travel to suppliers less frequently as well as keep her prices stable.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Create a reserve of non-perishable goods

loans.name: Cpk Ii Group

texts.en:
Matane sells scrap metal. She was taught by her mother from 1978 to 1979 the business of selling spices and smoked fish. From 1990 to 1994, she started her own business with a beginning capital of $100, selling cartons of tomatoes, onions and spices. In 1994, her aunt taught her how to sell scrap metal. She started this business with $100 as beginning capital. In 1995, she bought a stall at the market called Lufungula. With hard work and good management, Matane prospered in her business until 2006. She increased her working capital to $700.

From 2006 to 2007, her business decreased to $50 because of family difficulties due to rising rent costs and her husband’s long absence in Angola, without any news of his welfare. After this, she joined one of Hope’s groups in February 2007, and she reinforced her business by increasing the inventory. Currently, her working capital is $400 and she makes $100 per month as profit. Her ambition is to open a scrap metal store. Matane is married and the mother of five children between the ages of 7 and 20, who are all in school.

loans.use: To reinforce working capital

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap S. lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Ang Samruol, is a construction worker. Even though they both have careers, they still do not earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Sopheap S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She wants to earn more income to provide a better life for her family. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other four years old and too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winifred T. is 47 years old and the married mother of six children. Currently three of her children are in school, while the rest are schooling. She lives in Elmina in the central region of Ghana. Her husband owns a printing press in the community. 

Winifred sells clothing materials and cosmetics through hawking (that is, house-to-house selling). She has also managed to erect a wooden structure in front of her house where she sells cereals, like rice, and other foodstuffs. To support her children, she has been selling cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients through hawking. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make good income to sponsor her children's education. Winifred belongs to a village bank called Tabitha Kum.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.en:
Reynilda E. is a 39-year-old resident of Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. She is a widow with five children. She has a carenderia (food stall) business.

Reynilda started her business with the pension she gets from her deceased husband. But the pension and the income coming from the food stall is not enough to provide the daily needs of the family. That's why she wants to apply for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 4000 to purchase ingredients and materials for her food stall. This will be a great help for Reynilda to give the family a comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food stall

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bo

texts.en: Bo N. is thirty-eight years old and married with three young children, all too young to go to school. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province. She currently earns her daily income by planting crops on her own farmland that was inherited from her grandparents. Her husband is thirty-four years old and owns a car which he runs as a taxi service. Bo saw that the investment her neighbor made in selling groceries was a profitable one. That is why she has decided to seek a loan as capital to begin running a grocery store out of her house.

loans.use: To sell groceries from her house.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa M. is from the village of Panalsalan Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Josefa is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Josefa owns & operates a weaving business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling nipa hut and nipa mat. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josefa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josefa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is married with one small child. He sells clothing and shoes at a local open market in his city. He also goes out to neighboring villages to sell. Roman has been in this business for four years. His monthly profit is 3,000 UAH. He has many consistent clients, especially in villages where there are no markets. Sometimes he takes orders then brings the items to customers when he returns to the village.

Roman would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to increase his inventory. He hopes to take better care of his family's needs. His goal is to open his own little store in his city.

loans.use: Increase his inventory.

loans.name: Vinceansia

texts.en:
Four years ago, Vinceansia began farming sweet potatoes on a 1.5 hectare (3.75 acre) plot of land outside of the town of Rongo, Kenya. Working 10-hour days on the farm has not been easy, but she has managed to build up the business bit by bit over the years. She now employs several people to help her in the fields and has diversified into buying and selling grains in the marketplace of Rongo.

Vinceansia is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings so that she can improve her farm and increase her yield.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies to improve her farm and increase her yield

loans.name: Libio  Santiago

texts.es: El señor Libio y su esposa Cristina son dos personas muy responsables ya que ellos crían y cuidan a sus dos nietos. Ellos viven en la  Villa Salomé. Don Libio trabaja como chapista hace 40 años y actualmente tiene un Taller de Chapería de Movilidades en la misma casa donde vive. Él solicita el préstamo para la compra de una compresora nueva ya que su antigua compresora comenzó a fallar y tiene aún muchos trabajos por entregar.
texts.en:
Libio and his wife Cristina are very responsable people who are raising and caring for their two grandchildren. They live in Villa Salomé. Libio is a metalworker and has a workshop in his home for auto body repair. He is requesting a loan to purchase a new compressor because his old one is starting to fail and he still has a number of orders to complete.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a compressor

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 38-years old, married with two children and lives in Lagos.  She sells drinks and has been in this business for the past five years. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with two teenage children. She sells women's clothing at a small market in Melitopol city and has been in this business for 17 years. Large experience helps Valentina to choose right kind of inventories and make good sales. Valentina enjoys selling clothing; moreover, this business brings her stable income.
Valentina would like to borrow 12,900 UAH to purchase fall collection of women's clothing. She has used Hope loans before and considers them to be very helpful for her business.

loans.use: to purchase Fall collection

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en: S. Eddy is thirty-four years old and married with five children. He owns the charcoal store located in Katwe, Kalisizo North that sells both wholesale and retail. He is utilizing the loan to purchase more charcoal as his stock occasionally runs out, especially during the rainy season when it is in high demand. His hope for the future is to acquire a bigger store and become the sole distributor for the whole Kalisizo town. Once the profits accumulate he hopes to open another charcoal store in town, construct a better house in the village, and send his children to better schools.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mamadou Dit Ngouda

texts.fr: Mamadou dit Ngouda M.  est âgé de 31 ans et travaille comme électricien  à l’usine de transformation de produits halieutiques de la ville de Mbour situé à 80 km de la capitale Dakar. Parallèlement à cette activité il gère un véhicule de transport (taxi). Les revenus tirés du transport lui permet d’entretenir sa famille.   Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter un  moteur  pour dépanner sa voiture de transport urbain.

loans.use: achat moteur

loans.name: Estela Luzmila

texts.es:
La señora ESTELA LUZMILA O. G. , tiene 48 años, vive en el distrito de Otuzco , provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal EL OLIVO DE OTUZCO.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria.
ESTELA es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos y todos dependen económicamente de ella ya que se encuentran estudiando.
ESTELA se dedica a la preparación de cenas y almuerzos para eventos como:  matrimonios, bautizos, quinceañeros,  aniversarios, promociones, etc.
Pero también se dedica a lavar y planchar ropa de los trabajadores del campo, de los turistas, de sus vecinos, etc.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra productos alimenticios la por mayor para tener listo cuando tenga que preparara una cena.
Los producto los compra de Trujillo en donde los compra a menor precio y al por  mayor para obtener mayores ganancias.
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios como: arroz, Azucar, papas, menestras, fideos, aceite, etc.
ESTELA sueña con tener un restaurante y aumentar sus ganancias y así poder apoyar a que sus hijas puedan estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Sra. Estela Luzmila O. G. is 48 years old and lives in the District of Otuzco, Ortuzco Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “El Olivo de Otuzco”. Sra. Estela completed her studies through the 5th year of secondary school. She is in a common law marriage and has 4 dependent children who attend school.

Estela prepares lunches and dinners for special events such as weddings, baptisms, quinceañeros (girl’s 15th birthday), anniversaries, promotions, etc. She also provides laundry and ironing services for farm workers, tourists, neighbors, etc.

Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy food products at wholesale so that she would be ready to prepare meals. She buys her ingredients in Trujillo where the prices are lower and she can buy wholesale so that she can generate more income.

Estela is requesting another loan of 300 soles to purchase products such as rice, sugar, potatoes, dried vegetables, noodles, cooking oil, etc. She dreams of opening a restaurant and increasing her earnings so that she can support her daughters in their education and pursuit of professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, potatoes, dried vegetables, noodles, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.en:
K. Makhfirat is a married woman and has 4 children. She has been running her own business for 15 years already. Makhfirat sells clothes for kids in a store which is located in one of the intensively inhabited parts of the local market. She is very nice and polite and has many customers. The business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for the family.

Makhfirat has been a client of IMON for more than 4 years. She has managed to pay all her loans accurately and precisely. Now she requests 7000 Somoni to increase the range of her goods. Makhfirat deeply appreciates your support and sincerely thanks all of you.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for kids for the autumn/winter season

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 43 años, vive con sus dos hijas: Verónica de 23 y Lizbeth de 17 años. Ellas viven juntas y felices con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por eso que se ayudan mutuamente.

Martha se dedica a la preparación de panes y diferentes bizcochos para una panadería que le paga por sus servicios. Aprendió este oficio viendo como preparaban los panaderos, y después de un tiempo quiso empezar a prepararlos sola y lo logró con mucho empeño, además de buena memoria; mezcló ingredientes, imaginó figuras e impuso un nuevo estilo de formas de panes que hoy se lucen en la panadería, donde los consumidores pueden elegir detrás de la vitrina los panes más provocativos que quieran comprar. 
A Martha le gusta su trabajo y obtiene buenas ganancias, además también tiene una pequeña chacra donde siembra papa, su hija mayor que ya trabaja la ayuda económicamente y la menor la apoya en las labores de su casa; pues la meta de las tres es salir adelante y tener una panadería propia en la que ofrezcan los exquisitos productos que prepara esta trabajadora mujer que ha sabido asumir el rol de padre y madre sin ningún temor.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser muy seria y puntual con cada pago, además está satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque le permite trabajar con mujeres emprendedoras como ella. El dinero que solicita, menciona con ilusión, lo invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizantes y semillas de papa para lograr sembrar en mayor cantidad y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old and lives with her two daughters: Veronica, age 23 and Lizbeth, age 17. They live happily together and have a strong desire to get ahead, and in this respect they help each other. Martha produces bread and a variety of biscuits for a bakery which pays her for her services. She learned this trade by watching how the bakers work, and after a time she wanted to begin to produce on her own. She achieved this with great effort, and also a good memory; she mixed the ingredients and came up with shapes. She developed new styles of shapes of bread that today are displayed in the bakery where the customers are able to choose behind glass panels the most tempting breads that they wish to buy. Martha likes her job, and she obtains good earnings; in addition she has a small field where she grows potatoes. Her oldest daughter who works helps her economically, and the younger one helps with the household chores. The goal of the three is to succeed and to have their own bakery where they can offer the exquisite products that are created by their hardworking mother, who has managed to assume the role of father and mother without fear. This is the second loan that they have received from MFP, and they are committed to be responsible and punctual with every payment. In addition, they are content to work with their communal bank because they can work with enterprising women like themselves. The money that they are hoping to receive will be invested in the purchase of compost, fertilizer and potato seed to plant in large quantities to obtain increased earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her potato fields

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: D. Hélène est née en 1968 à Dassa-Zoumé dans les collines au Bénin. Mariée à HOUNSOUVO Galbert, un enseignant, Hélène est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge. C’est depuis deux ans que Hélène vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Dogoudo à Allada. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour répondre à ses besoins, Hélène vend du maïs, des bananes et de la farine de manioc à Allada. Hélène s’approvisionne à Allada et au marché Houègbo au Bénin. C’est depuis 16 ans que Hélène mène cette activité. Hélène a déjà obtenu de ALIDé, deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’augmenter le volume de son activité et de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Hélène sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Hélène was born in 1968 in Dassa-Zoumé in the hills of Benin. Married to HOUNSOUVO Galbert, a teacher, she is the mother of three children who are all in school. The couple has another child to support. For two years, she has been living with her children and husband in Dogoudo, in Allada. The couple provides for the family jointly. To meet her needs, Hélène sells corn, bananas, and cassava flour in Allada. She stocks up in Allada and at the Houègbo market in Benin. She has been in this business for sixteen years. She has already had two ALIDé loans, which have been repaid. With the aim of increasing her business volume and to cope with the demands of her customers, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six tubs of cassava flour and some plantains

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is 30 and married with 2 children, who are 5-months and 2 years-old.  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.    Malia needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

In 2009, Malia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

SPBD Social Metrics Scores for this Borrower:
Overall Social Metric Score:                3 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              3 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Liliana Medaly

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 19 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive junto a su esposo en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como agricultor no son suficientes para sustentar los gastos familiares. Se vió en la necesidad de iniciar hace algunos meses un negocio de comercialización de animales. Ella ya habia tenido experiencia en este rubro ya que anteriormente había ayudado a su madre en un negocio parecido.

Liliana compra animales (cerdos, aves de corral), los engorda y luego los comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque o a los negociantes que eventualmente visitan su caserío. Ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para cerdos.

Su más grande anhelo es tener una casa propia y ofrecerle a su hijo una educacion de calidad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Liliana is 19 years old, she is married and has a son, and she lives with her husband in her parents' home, located in the La Pava hamlet, Mochumí district, one hour away from Chiclayo city.

Given that the income her husband earns as a farmer is not enough to sustain the family, a few months ago she was forced to start an animal selling business. She had experience in this area because she had helped her mother in a similar business before.

Liliana buys animals (pigs, fowl), fattens them and then she sells them in Lambayeque's city market or to the traders that occasionally visit her hamlet. She finds herself asking Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a 1,200.00 PEN loan which she intends to invest in the purchase of balanced feed for pigs.

Her greatest wish is to have a home of her own and to offer her son an education of quality. She is an enterprising and very responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed for pigs

loans.name: Mairam

texts.en: S. Mairam is 64 years old and is married with two adult children. Her daughter is married and has her own family while her son is currently working in the Russian Federation. Mairam sells fabrics for sewing the national dresses and has been in this business almost for fifteen years. She has very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which textile to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her constant customers. Mairam dreams of opening another vending place so that her son can earn money in their motherland around his family. For this reason she asks for a loan of $2,500 USD. She promises to repay the loan without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. Your generosity can change their lives. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 26 years of age and married with four children between the ages of 8 and 14 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a three-room house where she stays with five people. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for her children and medication. Gorret owns a stall in Mengo Mackay selling bananas and tomatoes.  She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over 10 years. Her main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season because she works from an open place.  She sells at both retail and wholesale. She has been with MCDT for four years, servicing her seventh loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and boxes of tomatoes. She is hoping to see her business grow bigger and to start selling at wholesale only.
.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and tomatoes

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
Xiomara tiene 20, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron que toda labor es gratificante si se le pone esfuerzo y dedicación. Es así que hace 8 meses decidió ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, vendiendo productos de belleza, ya que es un trabajo que puede realizar con tranquilidad y en las horas que disponga de tiempo, pues también ayuda a su madre en las labores del hogar porque su padre trabaja durante todo el día como chofer. 

Xiomara fue poco a poco aprendiendo los secretos del comercio y actualmente lo desarrolla con mucho entusiasmo, puesto que le gusta mucho aconsejar a sus amigas del barrio y otras vecinas que solicitan de sus productos para mejorar su imagen. 

Su deseo a futuro es seguir mejorando en su negocio hasta tener su propio bazar donde sus productos sean mejor exhibidos y obtenga mejores ingresos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a cumplir muy responsablemente con todos pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos para tenerlos en stock y cuando le realicen los pedidos pueda cumplir con la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 20 years old. Since she was very young, her parents have taught her that all work is satisfying if one puts effort and dedication into it. Accordingly, 8 months ago, she decided to help her parents with the household expenses by selling cosmetics. This is work that she can easily undertake during the time available to her; she also helps her mother with the household chores, because her father works all day as a driver. Little by little, Xiomara has learned the secrets of selling, and she currently does it with great enthusiasm, since she truly enjoys advising her friends in the area and other neighbors who are interested in her products in order to improve their image. Her desire for the future is to continue making progress with her business until she can open her own bazaar, where her products will be more effectively displayed and she can earn a better income. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making all her payments in a very responsible manner. With the funds she is currently requesting, she will buy more products in order to have them in stock, so that when orders are placed, she can fulfill her customers' requests.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen P. is from the village of Sagay , Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Helen is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Helen is just starting this business , previous business  of Helen is into harvesting and selling fruits like lanzones.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 46 years old and married with two children. His wife is a caterer and she also supports her husband in meeting the basic needs of their family. Moses is well-loved in his community, especially by children, because he sells ice cream. He sells his ice cream at retail prices to his customers. 

He hopes to expand his business. His greatest challenge is funds and he hopes to overcome the challenge.  He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more ice cream to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz J. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Luz is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Luz buys and sells vegetables in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately $135 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luz is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Xenia Sulay

texts.es:
la sra. Xenia Sulay se dedica al comercio, vende ropa interior de la conocida y prestigiada línea LOVABLE, actividad que tiene de realizar desde hace mas de un año y la realiza de manera ambulante siendo sus mejores clientes las maestras de los diferentes centros educativos, empleadas de oficinas y empleados  de las diferentes manufactureras de tabacos existentes en la ciudad de Danlí y El Paraíso.
las ventas las realiza de contado y créditos lo que le permite tener clientela todo el año, me comentaba que a pesar de que estas prendas interiores son mas caras que las demás siempre se venden ya que son mucho mas duraderas y de mayor calidad, que hasta los varones muchas veces las compran para hacerle regalos a su pareja.
el credito lo utilizara en comprar mas ropa interior.
texts.en:
Xenia Sulay dedicates herself to commerce, selling undergarments from the well-known and popular line called LOVABLE. She has been carrying out this activity for more than one year, selling her products door-to-door. Her best customers are the teachers from the local schools, office workers, and employees of the various tobacco manufacturers in the cities of Danlí and El Paraíso. She sells both in cash and on credit, which allows her to have customers year-round. She tells us that, despite the fact that these garments are more expensive than others, they always sell well since they are of better quality. Even the men often buy them to give as a gift to their partners. The loan would be used to buy more garments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase undergarments for women, men and children.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter loves business and that is why he sells office stationeries like calculator at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to grow his business in the future. He sells for long hours to enable him meet the basic needs of his family. He is 34 years old, married with a child. His wife is a fashion designer and she also supports their home. Peter’s child attends school. He is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more office stationeries to sell. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more office stationeries to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocely P., from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, is 49 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Jocely owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 2400 PHP a month.

In 2006, Jocely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 25000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Jocely's fourth loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married with a 7-year-old daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Energodar, which is a predominantly agricultural region of eastern Ukraine. Anna sells seeds, farming chemicals and pesticides in a little farming store and another vending location at a market. She started this venture 10 years ago. Currently, she has about 150,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her working capital amounts to 50,000 Grivnyas. 

Anna is seeking a 20,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise for this farming season. She always tries to re-stock her inventory, keeping up with the demand and varied market. Anna is very prompt with payments and hasn’t had any delinquencies with any of her previous loans. One of Anna’s long-term plans is to remodel her little store in the future.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: La Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA LA ROSA DE SARON ESTA UBICADO EN EL PUEBLO DE JALOXTOC EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS,MEXICO, EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 5 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN DESDE YA MUCHO TIEMPO PORQUE SON VECINOS, ESTE ES EL PRIMER PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION REALIDAD

EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES LA SRA. CARMEN M. S. TIENE 52 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO LA PRIMARIA, TIENE DOS HIJOS VARONES YA CASADOS DE 31 AÑOS Y 32 AÑOS. SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TORTAS, TACOS DE ARROZ, JUGOS Y REFRESCOS, ESTA SOLICITANDO SU PRESTAMO PARA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO VA A COMPRA CHILES SECOS, REFRESCOS, SILLAS, MESAS Y TAMBIEN VA A ARREGLAR SU REFRIGERADOR. ESPERA TENER MAS GANANCIAS Y VOLVER A  INVERTIR EN EL NEGOCIO
SU CASA ESTA EN UNA ESQUINA ES DE 1 PISO.

EL SR. FACUNDO N. M. SE DEDICA A LOS ANTOJITOS
LA SRA. NANCY E. M. TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES 
LA SRA MANUELA M. P.  TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES
LA SRA NORMA J. B. SE DEDICA A LA VENTA POR CATALOGO
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called La Rosa de Saron (The Rose of Saron). It is located in the town of Jalxtoc in the state of Morelos in Mexico. The group is comprised of five members. They have known each other for a long time because they are neighbors. This is their first loan with the Fundación Realidad. Carmen M. S. represents the group. She is 52 years old, and she has an elementary school education. She has two sons who are married. They are 31 and 32 years old. She sells sandwiches, rice tacos, juice, and soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. She will buy dried chilies, soft drinks, tables, and chairs. She will also fix her refrigerator. She hopes to have more earnings and return to investing in her business. Her one story house is on a corner. Facundo N. M. sells snacks. Nancy E. M. has a grocery store. Manuela M. P. has a grocery store. Norma J. B. sells by catalog.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs, and merchandise like dried chilies and soft drinks

loans.name: Analen

texts.en:
Analen L. is from the village of Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old, single, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Analen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
From the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya, Marivel L. is a 34-year-old married mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, Marivel owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for breeding. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marivel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old. Rosita is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a beauty salon, where she provides manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This will be Rosita's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support members of her immediate family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Augustus Nyambati

texts.en:
Augustus is 50 years old and a married father to six children (aged between 8 and 16), who are all currently in school. He has a kiosk called 'Tumaini Kiosk' in the Langata Shopping Mall in Nairobi, where he sells products such as bread, sugar, cakes, tea leaves, and maize flour. Augustus has been in the business for 20 years, and dreams of opening a wholesale business. He hopes that within five years he'll be able to have a big shop and open another one in Kibera. 

Augustus has previously taken out two loans from Faulu Kenya, and since becoming a client, he says that he has increased his business and it is now quite stable. With his loan, Augustus plans to purchase products for his shop such as sugar, bread, and maize flour to increase stock at his store.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, bread, and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy nails, plates, and screws for fixing fractures

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 53 years old and is married with four children. She is well-known in the business of selling a variety of goods, which also includes the sale of tea. She has been in this business for about two years and her business hours are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Jeanne needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her shop through purchasing a variety of goods like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil and some other foodstuffs. With these additional goods, she will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future. In addition to that, she will continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil and some other foodstuffs for sale in her shop

loans.name: Jopeth Jay

texts.en:
Jopeth Jay L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 21 years old. He raises pigs to earn a living. He had to stop going to school because of financial difficulties in his family. Now he is happy to say that because of his business raising pigs, he is able to continue his college education. He also started farming. He plants and harvests rice crops for sale. He says it is a challenge to manage work and school time but he is determined to finish college and find a job so he can continue to help his family.

Jopeth Jay joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jopeth Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jopeth Jay is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) which will be used to purchase farm supplies, four piglets, and to repair his pig pen. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets and repair his pig pen

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 42 years old, married with four children who are between 9 and 21 years old.  Bernard is commonly known in the business of selling foodstuffs mainly beans and some other goods.  Bernard has been in this business for about six years.  The business hours are from 7 am to 10 pm every day.

Although Bernard has been in this business for about 6 years, his capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To end this, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will expand his business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, peas, wheat, etc.  With these additional foodstuffs for sale, he will hopefully earn more profits than previously and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting for a better financial stability.

loans.use: a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata, de 41 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edgar de 40 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Fortunata se dedica, es el cultivo de cacao, café y hoja de coca. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha en la ciudad de San Francisco, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. En adelante, espera sembrar todas sus tierras, pata obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas.
