She knows this is the only source of income she can do for now, but really is trying to do her best to expand for further sources of livelihood.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia R. V. es una señora de 41 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, desde hace varios años doña Virginia inició un negocio de confección de ropa. Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.  Ella elabora diferentes tipos de prendas tales como: como cortinas, ropa de cama y toda clase de prendas de vestir, que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores o incluso la llegan a buscar a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Actualmente doña Virginia requiere un préstamo de ¢385,000 (trescientos ochenta y cinco  mil colones)  para comprar materiales tales como telas, hilos, encajes, entre otros, requeridos para confeccionar toda clase de prendas. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá atraer a más clientes, ofrecer mejores alternativas y mejorar considerablemente la calidad de sus productos. 

Doña Virginia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Virginia R. V., 41, lives with her husband and children in Las Delicias de Upala, a small, rural community in Costa Rica, which is located in the Alajuela province. This is where she engages in businesses like raising livestock for two reasons (meat and milk) and planting basic grains like rice, beans, corn, and others. Several years ago, due to the few sources of employment the community offers, Virginia started a business of making clothes. She did this to help her husband with the household expenses. She makes different types of things such as curtains, bedding, and all kinds of clothes. She later sells her work to businesses in her community and surrounding areas. Some people go to her house looking for her goods. Her small business has helped considerably to improve her family’s quality of life. She says that the success of her business is based upon being able to offer a good service to people and meeting their needs. Virginia currently needs a loan for ¢385,000 (three hundred eighty five thousand colones) to buy materials like fabric, thread, lace, among other things to make all types of items. Thanks to this loan she will be able to attract more customers, offer more choices, and considerably improve the quality of her products. Virginia is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, one of the one hundred organizations partnered with Edesa in Costa Rica. This is her third loan, and she hopes to keep growing on a personal and economic level. Thanks to these types of organizations and agencies facilitating loans, she can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita, a 25-year-old single woman living with her parents, has been working as a beautician since 2007. Today, Rita is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase a laser machine in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a laser machine

loans.name: Leonarda Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 04 hijos y  tiene estudios de secundaria completa,  vive Centro Poblado de Paucarcolla.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite, etc.

Su deseo es comprar su casita.

A ella le gustan los ahorros,  las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Leonarda belongs to the “Santiago Apostol” community bank, which is located in the district of Paucarcolla, province of San Roman, department of Puno, she is 43, married, has four children and finished high school, she lives in the Paucarcolla town. Whe has worked with Manuela Ramos for six years, her initial loan was S/.300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy groceries. Now she requests a loan of S/.500 nuevos soles, to purchase rice, sugar, milk, pasta, oil, etc. Her dream is to buy a house. She likes to save, get together and converse.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, pasta, milk, sugar

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.en:
In this photo, Señora Lizbeth shows her jewelery catalogs and the few products she has left after having had a month of good sales.  Lizbeth sells clothes, costume jewelry and other merchandise.  She works independently with the loans she receives from the Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos.  Lizbeth is thirty-three years old and is married with two young children.  Her husband is a high school teacher.  The family lives in the city of Pucallpa.  

Lizbeth has been working with Manuela Ramos for about ten years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  With her first loan of 300 soles (about $100), she purchased regional farm products such as plantain and chickens to later resell in the city.  Lizbeth will use this loan of 1600 soles to purchase clothing and costume jewelery to sell.  All of her merchandise is ordered in advance by her customers.

Lizbeth's goal is to construct a second story for her house.  Once this construction is finished, Lizbeth plans to convert the first floor into a store where she can display her merchandise and hopefully increase her sales.  Lizbeth is grateful for the financial assistance she has received from Manuela Ramos.  She also appreciates the educational sessions (about how to expand and improve one's business) given by Manuela Ramos' loan officers at each monthly meeting of her communal bank.

loans.use: To buy clothing and costume jewelry to sell

loans.name: Asuncion Gemma

texts.en:
Asuncion Gemma Lachica is a 45-year-old entrepreneur. She and her husband, Reiner, have six children, ages 5 to 19 years old. She wants all of her children to have their own career someday, so she wants to send all of them to school until they graduate from college. With only her husband’s income from his job as a utility worker, this may not turn into reality. Her husband’s income is sufficient only for food and other basic needs, but not when educational expenses are included. 

Asuncion Gemma wanted her own business so she could have her own income. Her motivation led her to Ahon Hirap, Inc. (ASHI). In 2003, Asuncion Gemma became a member of ASHI and has taken a loan to staring her business. She started with one business, but after several loans, Gemma now has several businesses. 

She raises hogs, cattle, and chickens, and she buys and sells rice. The profits from her livestock businesses have doubled. It takes four months to raise a pig, one year to raise a cow, and 45 days to raise a chicken. When the animal is mature, they are sold in the market, either alive or slaughtered. 

Asuncion Gemma sells rice from their own house. Her customers are her neighbors. She is now planning to buy and sell coconut from her house as well.
 
Through the loans that she can get from ASHI, if she maintain her good performance as a member, Asuncion Gemma foresees her businesses succeeding and growing.

loans.use: To finance her livestock and rice businesses and to start a coconut business

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
P. is a 46 year old open-minded and hardworking single mother. She lives with her four children in Arkhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her youngest daughter attends high school. Her older children have already finished school and have started working. 

She started her boot making and shoe repair business in 2002 with an investment of 14 USD. She makes Mongolian traditional boots and her children support her in producing and selling the products. After years of saving her profits, she now has nearly 270 USD in working capital.  Besides her shoe and boot production business, P. also grows vegetables in her yard in order to support her family's household needs. In the future, she not only wants to improve her business, but she is also thinking about expanding her business by opening a second location. P. is requesting a loan of 600,000 tugrugs (~415 USD) to purchase more raw materials to produce boots.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials to produce boots

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
M. Bahodir is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 6 years. He is baking the national bread “lepeshka” at home. He believes that this business is profitable and is not the subject to the seasonality. He is getting up early and baking the lepeshka and bread so that people have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. All the input materials like the flour, salt, yeast he is purchasing in the local market. Now due to high demands Bahodir wants to increase the number of his breads so that he requests for a loan of $1500 USD. The loan will be spend for purchasing the flour, and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Bahodir deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the flour as a wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Claudia es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Claudia junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura de papa en terrenos alquilados, sus productos los vende la ciudad de Lima. Además tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte de carga.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de petróleo.
Claudia sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes por mayor.

loans.use: Para la compra de petróleo.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une femme de 46 ans elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 1 an et demi. Avec son crédit elle développe une petite activité de vente de fournitures scolaires qui lui permet de dégager des bénéfices pour la prise en charge quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a 45-year old woman and she is married and is the mother of 9 children. She has been a member of the Yamatogne village bank for the past year and a half. She will invest her loan in a small business selling school supplies, which provides her an income to provide for the daily needs of her family.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital.

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es:
Isabela tiene 46 años, está casada y es madre de tres hijos con los que viven en su casa propia. 
La mayor preocupación de Isabela y su esposo es mantener limpia de arbustos sus plantas de café y plátanos. Cada cierta temporada abonan cada mata con la finalidad que su producción no  merme, sobro todo los plátanos, ya que cada quince días van recolectados los frutos para venderlos en su misma chacra y con estas ganancias solventa los gastos de alimentación de su hogar.
En el caso del café esperan de mayo a julio que son los meses de cosecha, tiempos en que trabajan con mucha alegría de sol a sol; y finalmente llevan su producto a las acopiadoras de su zona, estos son tiempos de bonanza e inversión para su familia. 
Por tal motivo, Isabela jamás se cansa de su labor agrícola, pues gracias a ella ha podido educar a sus hijos, quienes son su mayor adoración.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta y entusiasmada, por lo se compromete de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Isabella is 46 years old and lives in her own home. She is married and the mother of three children.

The biggest concern for Isabella and her husband is clearing their coffee and banana fields and keeping them free of bushes and shrubs. Every season they fertilize each plant in order to promote fruit production, especially the bananas. They gather fruit every two weeks and sell them directly from their farm. With the earnings they generate, they are able to feed themselves and cover their household expenses.

With regard to the coffee crop, Isabella must wait until May through July since those are the harvesting months. She happily works from sunrise to sunset during this time of year. When the last of the crop is gathered for sale, her family takes time to celebrate their success with one another. For this reason, Isabella never gets tired of farming. Thanks to her work, she has been able provide an education to the children she greatly adores.

This is her second loan with MFP. Isabella is happy and enthusiastic about being part of her Communal Bank and promises to make all of her payments on time. She will use the money to buy chemical fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Djiguiya (Recours) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya du quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala est  composé de quatre  femmes dont trois  mariées et une veuve avec une moyenne de 48 ans et 3 enfants. Les membres du groupe Djiguiya vivent dans des familles polygames et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et professionnel. 
L’activité dominante des femmes de ce groupe est l’achat vente de sounbala, des produits cosmétiques et des condiments alimentaires.
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt,  le groupe Djiguiya est à son  deuxième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 sacs de noix de soja ou du néré, de la matière première pour la fabrication des produits cosmétiques et de diverses marchandises pour la vente en détail. Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des producteurs et grossistes de Koutiala. La vente des produits est faite sur place à la maison, au marché et en ambulant dans  les  quartiers de la ville  de Koutiala.  
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25000CFA chacune par mois. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser  le prêt et son intérêt, contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et participer à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité des enfants. 
Les membres du groupe Djiguiya  envisagent  s’installer au grand marché de Koutiala au nom de l’association.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group of the Hamdallaye district of the prefecture of Koutiala is composed of four women, three married women and one widow, with an average age of 48 and on average 3 children. The members of the Djiguiya group live in polygamous families and know each other through ties of kinship, or because they live in the same neighborhood, or through their businesses.

The main business of these women is buying and selling 'sounbala' (a condiment), cosmetics, and other condiments. After having reimbursed their first loan, the Djiguiya group are on their second solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

This loan will be used to buy 20 sacks of soy nuts or 'néré', raw materials for making cosmetic products, and various merchandise to be sold retail. They do their buying from the producers and wholesalers of Koutiala. Sales are made out of their homes, at the market, or on foot in the neighborhoods of the town of Koutiala.

With this loan, they expect to make an average profit of 25,000 CFA each every month. This profit will be used to reimburse the loan and the interest, to contribute to covering everyday family expenses, and to participate in paying school fees for their children. The members of the Djiguiya group hope to be able to set themselves up in the big open-air market of Koutiala as an association.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.es:
El señor Leobardo C. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo mucho a su negocio.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía de temperado ya que tiene muy poco inventario y esta temporada es una de las mejores ventas que hay, es por eso que quiere invertirle al negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de la inversión, ya que los gastos familiares se cubrirán con la pensión que recibe.
texts.en:
Leobardo C. is very grateful for his last loan which helped him a lot with his business. He is asking for another loan to buy seasonal merchandise as he has very little inventory and this season is one of the best for sales. Because of this, he wants to invest in his business now.

He plans to pay back his loan with the earnings from his business, because his household expenses will be covered by the pension he receives.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying merchandise

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en: Dorjpalam B. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three teenage children in Arhangai Province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest son is 19 years old and goes to a college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The younger two daughters are 11 and 15 years old and go to local secondary schools. Dorjpalam started his small retail business with the capital of 30,000 Mongolian tugrugs (US$1 equals about 1,450 MNT) in 2006. He started his business by selling various dairy products including cheese, curds, and milk cream. Today, he rents a stall at the local black market and sells a greater variety of dairy products with an increased business capital of 3,000,000 MNT. Because he sells good quality products, he already has many loyal, regular local customers. He says that in his business, he has always prioritized customer satisfaction, which always follows good quality products and welcoming service. He has requested a loan to purchase more dairy products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Berejina

texts.en: Berejina S. is currently in the business of selling bread and tomatoes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell. Berejina is 32 years old and is divorced. She has dix children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mactar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar N. est un jeune ouakamois de 29 ans sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis 5 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfants  mais doit subvenir a ses charges personnelles. Depuis 6 ans il s’adonne a l’aviculture. C’est un moyen pour lui de ne pas tomber dans le piège du chômage. Pour lui l’étape la plus passionnante dans son activité c’est la période des 10 premiers jours marquée par leur évolution. Monsieur N. sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour l’achat de poussins afin d’augmenter le nombre de ses sujets. Il est orphelin de mère, son père étant retraite ses revenus lui permettent de soutenir ses membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Matar N. is a young, 29 year old, resident of Ouakam and a member of the U-IMCEC credit union for the last 5 years. He is single with no children, but must meet personal expenses. For the past 6 years, he has been raising poultry. It is a way for him to avoid falling into the trap of unemployment. For him, the most exciting stage is their 10 first days of development. Mr N. requesting a loan of 150 000 francs for the purchase of chicks to increase his flock. Since he lost his mother, and his father is retired, his income allows him to support his family members.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chicks

loans.name: Isaías

texts.es: El Sr. Isaías G. es trabajor de la universidad unan Carazo se desempeña como vigilante tiene 20 años de trabajar para esta institución es el segundo crédito con nosotros  es casado padre de 3 hijos uno en edad escolar el crédito lo solicita para compra de un terreno y así poder empezar a hacer su casa y si le han ayudado los créditos que le hemos financiado ya que en el crédito anterior su esposa iba a dar  a luz a su tercer bb y el dinero los utilizo para esos gastos.
texts.en:
Sr. Isaías G. has been employed by UNAN (National Autonomous University of Nicaragua) for 20 years as a security guard. This will be the second loan he has received from CEPRODEL. Isaías is married and the father of three children, of whom one is attending school. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase land so that he can start building a home. His previous loan was a great help since it was used when his wife gave birth to their third child. The money was used to pay for the related expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase land

loans.name: Teofanny

texts.en:
Teofanny L. is from the village of  Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years-old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Teofanny owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Teofanny has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Teofanny joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofanny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Teofanny is requesting a second loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Hisayn

texts.ru: Аюбов Хисайн проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хисайн более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает мужскую одежду. Этот бизнес приносит доход. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Hisayn A. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 27 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. Hisayn has been involved in retail sales for over 5 years. He has a store, where he sells men's clothing. This business brings in an income. Hisayn is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more, rice, soap, cooking oil and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: tools and raw materials for metal fabrication

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda Traoré est un homme marié de 44 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants  à Keleya, un village, chef lieu d’une commune rurale, située à 25 kilomètres de Ouelessebougou.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus.
De la vente de bétails pendant des années, il mène il ya maintenant  5 ans  le  métier  de boucher qui lui réussi mieux. Il a appris cette activité auprès d’un de ses amis.
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un autre client Soro Yiriwaso, il décide de collaborer avec l’institution.
Il est à  son premier prêt individuel qu’il compte  utiliser pour acheter, des animaux sur pieds pour les abattre.                                                                                                        Il s’approvisionne à Keleya et dans les villages environnants auprès des éleveurs. Il effectue sa vente au marché Keleya aux abords la route internationale Bamako Abidjan. Il a une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Monsieur Daouda Traoré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il ambitionne construire une maison à Ouelessebougou  pour son avenir et ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Daouda Traoré is a 44-year-old married man who is the father of three living with his wife and children in Keleya, a village that is the seat of a rural community located 25 km from Ouelessebougou.  Not having had modern schooling, he started income-generating businesses at a young age.  From selling cattle for years, he has been a butcher by trade for five years now.  This has been more successful for him.  He learned this business from one of his friends.  Having become familiar with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso through another Soro Yiriwaso client, Daouda decided to collaborate with the institution. He is now on his first individual loan, which he intends to use for buying some livestock for slaughter. He supplies himself in and around the village of Keleya from livestock farmers. He makes his sales at the Keleya market on the side of the international road leading from Bamako to Abidjan. He has a varied and diverse customer base. Douda plans on making a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. With this profit, he has the ambition of building a house in Ouelessebougou for his future and his children's future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying steers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn J. is from the village of Tubod. She is 28 years old. Jocelyn is married and has five children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a hog-raising business in the agricultural sector, raising pigs for sale. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2005, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy feeds and other vaccines

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata K. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUNKANE3 depuis 2006, et suite au décès de la présidente dudit Banc Villageoise elle a été élue à ce poste il y a de cela un an. Elle est vendeuse de crème glacée et de bananes. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter sa production afin de prétendre à plus de bénéfices pour pouvoir participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie et charges familiales.
texts.en:
Fatoumata K., 44, is married and raising three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of KOUNKANE3 since 2006, and following the death of the president of this Banc Villageoise, she was elected to that post a year ago. She sells ice cream and bananas. Her new loan will allow her to expand her business so she can make more profit and better participate in improving living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr: Haby B. ets une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOYINGUEL depuis 4 ans et demi et a bénéficié 9 fois de suite de crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter une paire de bœufs, de les engraisser pendant au moins 5 mois et les revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone. Son objectif principal est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Haby B. is a 41-year-old married mother of 6 young children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Bouyinguel for four and a half years and has had 9 loans. She fattens cattle, and her new loan will allow her to buy a pair of beef cattle, fatten them for at least five months, and resell them in the weekly markets in her area. Her main goal is to participate in the care of her family and to strengthen their level of savings.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pair of beef cattle and fatten them for resale

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a 41-year-old lady who is married to R. M.. She lives with her husband, two daughters and three sons in a city called Chichawatni in Pakistan. Three of her children are studying while the other two are too young to go to school. Kosar is a housewife and carries out her responsibilities as a wife and mother very well.

Kosar’s husband works in his field and he is the only breadwinner in the family. He wants to expand his business by putting in more seeds and using better fertilizers. Therefore, Kosar has applied for her first loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizer for his field and be able to produce good crops from it.

Kosar hopes that it will be a good experience for her and for her family as well.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her husband's field

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario B. is from the village of Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 55 years old. Hilario is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Hilario owns & operates a business raising carabao (water buffalo) for sale. Hilario has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Hilario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Hilario is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional animals to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Hilario from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Dembagnouma Ii Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de dix femmes  toutes mariées, le membres du groupe Dembagnouma II  ont en moyenne 29 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et  vivent dans des familles polygames à Wobougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MARAMOU D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,8 hectare  d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla ou Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The Dembagnouma II group is composed of 10 married women with an average age of 29, an average of 3 children, and they live in polygamous families in Wobougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow, among other crops, rice, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. They are on their second seasonal loan and their previous loan was repaid in full. With this new loan, Maramou D. plans on buying fertilizer and small farming equipment, and paying the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1.8 hectares of peanuts. The harvested crops are sold in Dioïla or Massigui to a client base made up of both men and women. She hopes to make a profit of 75,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen T. is 28 years old and lives in Kapan. He is married and has a two-year-old son and a new newborn son too. For about six years Armen has managed his own café where he serves his clients and also takes orders for meal preparation without home delivery.

Armen wants to increase the number of his clients, so he increased the area of his café. With his first Kiva loan Armen was able to install the framework of his café’s roof (which you can see on the photo). Now Armen asks for his second Kiva loan (1,000,000 Armenian dram) to slate his cafe's roof and to repair the inside of his café.

loans.use: repair and construction of a cafe

loans.name: Basiliza

texts.en:
This is Basiliza S., 53, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Maximiano S., who is also her business partner. She is the mother of their six children, five of whom are already working and are settled down with their own families, while the youngest is currently enrolled in college. By the grace of God, Basiliza has managed to support her youngest child's schooling up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to continue sending her youngest to college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Basiliza, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Basiliza operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing, electronic phone load, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of $5 to $7.50 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Basiliza dreams to be able to give her youngest child a quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Gregora

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria  tiene 76 años , ella Viuda, vive y trabaja con dos de sus Nietas.
Ella mantiene a su pequeña familia con una  Despensa desde el año 1995,  es cliente de Fundación Paraguaya cuando a un vivía su esposo.
Sus nietas  ademas de la despensa  trabaja los fines de semana vendiendo ropas para damas , caballero y niños, por lo tanto ya que retiran y firman juntos usando  ambos  dividiéndose según los pedidos que tengan y según sus Capacidad de pago. 
Este crédito van a utilizar en la compra de bebidas como cerveza ,gaseosas, Vinos y caña, lácteos, panificados , yerba ,azúcar, café etc. y su nieta ropas de la Nueva Temporada Primavera Verano. 
Su deseo es construir  ampliar  mas  hacia el frente  de la casa.
texts.en:
Greogria, 76, is a widow. She lives and works with two of her granddaughters. She supports her small family with a grocery store she’s had since 1995. She has been a client of Fundación Paraguaya since her husband was still living. Her granddaughters, besides working in the grocery store, also work weekends selling clothing for women, men and children. Therefore, they withdraw and sign together using both and divide it up according to the orders they might have and their ability to pay. The loan will be used to buy beverages like beer, soft drinks, wines and sugar cane, dairy products, baked goods, herbs, sugar, coffee, etc. and her granddaughter will buy clothes for the new spring-summer season. Her wish is to add on to the front of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like: sugar, milk, noodles, rice, baked goods, dairy products, meats and others.

loans.name: Lyroche

texts.en:
Lyroche F. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 45 years old. Lyroche is married and has a grown child. To make a living, Lyroche owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs for fattening and sale. Lyroche works hard to improve her family's living conditions.

Lyroche joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lyroche has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lyroche is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Wellingtone

texts.en: Wellingtone is a married man with three children.  He owns and runs a barber shop to make a living.  Most of his customers are the people of his local area.  Besides running his business, he is employed as a technician in a company that manufactures sweets.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy a shaving machine and an electric heater.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine and an electric heater

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr: Elom est une femme de 27 ans elle est mariée et vit avec son époux dans le quartier d'avédji qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. son  mari est un technicien employé dans une société de la place. Il a nommé son entreprise " GIFT of GOD". elle s'approvisionne très souvent au grand marché de Lomé qui est un marché très dynamique à lomé; elle a une ancienneté de 6 ans dans ce commerce. sa clientèle est en majorité féminine. pour répondre à la demande de plus en plus élevée de sa clientèle surtout en cette période de fête de fin d'année.elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 10 cartons de défrisant, 2 cartons de mèches et 2 cartons de tissages.
texts.en: Elom is a 27 year-old married woman who lives with her husband in the Avédji quarter which is on the outskirts of Lomé. Her husband is a technician and works for a company nearby.  She called her business 'Gift of God'. She sources her goods from the large market in Lomé which is very dynamic.  She has been running this business for over 6 years and her customer base is mainly made up of women. In order to meet her customers' growing demand she is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy 10 packs of hair straighteners, 2 boxes of highlight inserts and 2 boxes of weaves.

loans.use: purchase of hair straighteners, weaves and other products

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 20 years old, single and working and living in Saida, in the south of Lebanon. For two years Ali has been operating an auto repair workshop, during which time his business has grown steadily. While he didn't have many customers to start with, he is now very popular and has a good number of clients who are his friends and neighbours. Ali is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to purchase tools and stock for his auto repair workshop, and in the future hopes to be able to buy his own workshop premises.

loans.use: Buy tools & stock for his workshop

loans.name: Manassé Plus Group

texts.en:
Bibi B. is the leader of a community bank named “Manassé Plus”, made up of 10 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Bibi sells shikwanges (a kind of bread made of manioc flour), which is Kinshasa’s main food. She also sells peanuts, cakes, handbags, and miscellaneous items.  She sells in a market located in the northeastern part of Kinshasa.  She has been in business since 1985. She has borrowed eight loans from the MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and has fully repaid them. 

With the next loan, Bibi will be able to meet her customer demand and generate additional profits. Her business makes US$50 of profit per week. One of Bibi’s strategies to keep her clients is that she tells them in advance about any change that can occur in business. Her ambition is to open a shikwanges facility in her area. 

Bibi is 53 years old, married, and has two children. All of them attend school.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Consuelo Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Consuelo es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 10 años  de edad, los mismos que  estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño local en la calle Chile, que es una calle donde muchos comerciantes venden sus productos en la ciudad, en el vende ropa interior de caballeros, trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Sus productos los compra en Picoaza en una distribuidora que le venden a buen precio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar camisetas e interiores de caballeros. Sus sueños son tener un gran bazar con mucha mercadería.
texts.en:
The 22 de Julio (July 22nd) Community Bank meets every other week in the Picoaza church in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known to be a very commercial zone, also known for its traditional celebrations for Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the happiness of its people.

Mrs. Consuelo was a founding member of the community bank and she likes it for the additional benefits it provides and for the ease of the loan process. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are 18, 15, and 10 years old. Her children study at the University, high school, and primary school. Her husband is a salesman.

She works in sales. She has a small store on Chile Street, where many salespeople sell their products in the city. She sells men's underwear and works from 8:00 am unitl 5:00 pm. She buys her products in Picoaza from a distributor who sells them to her for a good price.

This loan is to buy t-shirts and men's underwear. She dreams of having a big store with a lot of merchandise.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts and men's underwear

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente  frutas como mango, limón y maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno en unos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El cría sus vacas alimentándolas de pastos y granos, diariamente ofrece en venta la leche que estas producen a la municipalidad, que las reparte a los sectores más pobres del distrito. Adicionalmente trabaja como agricultor en un pequeño terreno de cultivo de su propiedad. Usualmente siembra frutas como el mango y granos como el maíz. Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades el se hace cargo de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Pablo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que sus vacas pueda brindar una mejor producción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su meta.
texts.en: Pablo is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, Peru, a semitropical zone that primarily produces fruits such as mangoes, lemons and passion fruit. It is part of the Piura region, situated more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lamayeque region. Pablo makes a living raising cattle at corrals located near his home. He raises his cows on a diet of grass and grain, and he sells the milk they produce daily in town, which includes the poorest sections of his district. Additionally, he works as a farmer on a small plot of land on his property. Usually he plants fruits like mangoes and grains like corn. With the revenue from these activities he is able to make headway for his family. Pablo wishes to acquire balanced feed for his cows so they are able to improve their milk production. To achieve this, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed so his cows will have better milk production

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida B. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married and has 9 adult children. Zenaida owns & operates an agricultural business, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Zenaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for maintenance and to purchase seedlings for her farm. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Ke Y. is a married woman and the mother of eight children. She now has three grown sons who work in other jobs in Phnom Penh, and another son who is a worker in the rubber plantation. Her sons provide their small incomes to contribute to the family. Ke Y. has a partner in her husband, Bun Vorn, who is a local farmer in Kompong Tom province. To make a living, Ke Y. owns a small store next to her house where she sells Khmer cakes and other goods in front of her house. She built a new house a year ago but the construction process is not entirely completed, due to lack of money. Therefore, Ke Y. is requesting a loan to buy wood in order to finish building her new house.

loans.use: To buy wood in order to finish building her new house.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina A. is from the town of Surallah. She is 41 years old. Josefina is married and has a 20-year-old child. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn and pineapples for sale. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Josefina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her family's house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is a married woman who lives in Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a sound and light equipment rental business and selling fish. Her husband Artemio, who is 44 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living.  They have five children who are between 11 and 19 years old. Divina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Divina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000 to buy disco lights and fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Divina B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase disco lights to rent and fish to sell

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a seamstress by trade. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients in order to share the financial burden with her husband. She is very skillful and receives regular orders from her neighborhood clients every month. She completes their orders on time and has a good reputation for her good work in the community. 

She is also a very good housewife and does her household duties, staying at home.  She has given birth to a son and five daughters. She couldn’t enroll any of her children in school except her eldest daughter. Her husband operates a grocery store in the market. Through his store, he sells daily use items such as salt, sugar, cooking oil, spices etc. He is well known among his clients due to his good behavior and reasonable prices. 
 
Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries in bulk to put into his store to sell. This will allow him to offer more variety of products to his customers and earn better profits. Nazia is hopeful that an investment will make her husband’s business more profitable and will also expand his business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; la socia tiene 33 años de edad casada y tiene 5 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura ella siembre lo que son papas,trigo,cebada entre otros para luego venderlos en las ferias que se realizan los días sábados en el mercado de hunacaro por el centro de la ciudad, la socia lleva años en esta actividad el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales ella se siente muy feliz con su trabajo siendo de esta manera que ella saca a sus hijos adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, semillas entre otros para seguir sembrando sus productos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, "VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA", which is located in the Yuncaypata community in the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Ana is 33 years old and has five children.  She alternates her daily activities with growing crops such as potatoes, wheat and barley, among others.  She sells her produce at the Saturday market in Hunacaro in the city center.  She has been involved in this activity for several years and it has brought her considerable economic as well as personal satisfaction.  She enjoys her work which is a way to provide for her children.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds so she can continue growing crops.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to continue growing crops

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married to a farmer with three children — two girls and one boy who all attend school. Amina and the family live at a house that they own. It does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a farming business, planting maize for sale. She also operates a khanga (cloth) business that contributes to her other source of income. She operates at the market and from home, selling to neighbors. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, transportation of goods becomes difficult in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting she wants to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farm and add bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farm and add bales of khangas (cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Emilse

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emilse; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pollipapa que es un plato que consiste de pollo y papas fritas y lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia trabaja desde las 11:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de pollipapa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo y papas al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Emilse belongs to the Communal Bank “San Isidro de Yanahura – 5to Paradero” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has six children. Emilse divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling “pollipapa”, a dish that consists of chicken and fried potatoes. She sells her food as a street vendor in the District of Urubamba. Emilse works from 11am to 9pm. With this business, she has been able to help her children move forward. She wants to expand her food business, so she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for cooking such as chicken and potatoes in bulk.

Emilse is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients in bulk for cooking, such as chicken and potatoes.

loans.name: Gina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gina de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, esta felizmente casada ya hace 25 años y su esposo trabaja con chófer en una cooperativa de bus y fruto de su relación tiene 7 hijos, 2 mujeres y 5 varones ya todos mayores de edad. Su actividad comercial es taller de costuras.

Comenzó hace unos años atrás cuando su mama cocía y ella le enseño posteriormente luego de casarse decidió abrir su negocio de confección en su casa para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. En lo general ella labora diariamente desde la mañana hasta el medio día que atiende a sus hijos y luego continua en su costuras. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea compara materiales para sus confecciones como telas y materiales para adecuar su vivienda. En un futuro con la bendición de Dios quiere tener mas fuerzas para seguir trabajando y ver a sus nietos crecer y lógicamente terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Gina is 52 years old and lives in an urban area in the the suburb of Guayaquil. She has been happily married for 25 years. Her husband works a driver for a bus cooperative. She has seven children, two women and five men all of them are adults. Her business is a sewing workshop.

She started sewing a few years ago. Gina's mother sewed and she showed Gina how to sew. After she got married she decided to open her own clothing business at home to support her husband with household expenses. In general, she works every day from morning until noon when she takes care of her children and then continues with her sewing. With the help of the loan she wants to purchase materials to make clothing such as fabric and materials to renovate her home. In the future, with God's blessing, she wants to have more strength to keep working and to see her grandchildren grow and of course to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials to renovate her home.

loans.name: Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Ol is 43 years old.  She is married and has two children who are attending school.  She lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband are local cultivators. They currently generate an income of approximately $4 per day from their farming business.  

Presently, this family faces a problem with their living conditions, as their house is so old and narrow that it is difficult for the whole family to live in. Because of this reason, Mrs. Ol has decided to request a loan from Kiva in order to renovate and repair her old house. With this loan, she and her family can live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: repair her house

loans.name: Sorry For We Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sorry For We” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Dorise is the leader of this group. Dorise is age 40; she was born in the city of Kenema where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary school and secondary school respectively . Dorise sells fish. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy fish in bulk.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of Mamuwa, a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria Rosa tiene 35 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Maria  se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz y el esposo se dedica a la albañeria para auentar los ingresos en terrenos de los padres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es tener terrenos y casa propia.

Le gusta las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Maria Rosa is 35 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Canton Guaranda Privince of Bolivar.

The members of the V.R.C. Bellavista are located in the Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo community, Guaranda settlement at a distance of 15 minutes from the office of the cooperative. This location has 11 members that work in agriculture, animal raising, and other activities.

Maria works in agriculture sowing potatoes, wheat, and corn. Her husband works as a bricklayer to increase the income in the parents' land. The purchases are made in the Guaranda market and she sells them in the wholesale market in the same city.

She is asking for the loan to buy fertilizers for the crops. With the support of the loan, she would be helped economically to supply her needs and face challenges like plagues and illnesses. Her dream is to have plots of land and a house of her own.

She likes the carnaval holildays.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Marilet

texts.en:
Marilet is 33 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of four school-age children.

Marilet is a farmer. She owns and operates a business venture of planting and harvesting. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling banana fruit. She has been engaged in this type of business for five years. Each month, she earns a total of about 5,000 PHP (~$125) doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor cost of weeding. Marelit has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her banana business and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay the labor cost for weeding.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily, 61, a resident of Tanza, a part of Cavite City in the Philippines. She is married to Jose, a driver and is the mother of two children, both of whom are working. Her husband and she manage their own household while operating their businesses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emily operates a variety store adjacent to her house. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP’s worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Emily profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. She also runs a tricycle unit (motorcycle with sidecar) and sells mineral water to the community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and those in the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every day.

Emily is requesting a 21,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy groceries, various products and mineral water to expand her inventory. A portion of the loan will also be used for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Emily hopes to be able to grow her businesses soon, just as she hopes to hand them over to the next generation. She faithfully attends meetings with her co-fellowship* members every week where she shares stories of her work and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products for her business and for maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  He is 39 years old, married to Margaret, and they have four school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow to boost his income.

In future, Paul hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La Señora Pabla tiene 41 años D. edad, está casada con el Señor José D. 46 años D. edad, ellos llevan 22 años D. casados y tienen la dicha D. tener 7 hijos.
La Señora Pabla  es comerciante, cuenta con una despensa en su domicilio y su esposo cuenta con un automóvil en la cual se dedica a la venta ambulante D. prendas D. vestir, calzados, artículos D. mercería por zonas aledañas, ellos se dedican a esto hace 15 años.
Dicha actividad lo emprendieron con mucho sacrificio con un pequeño ahorro que contaban y fueron prosperando ya que desean darle una vida digna a sus hijos, y que ellos no pasen por las mismas necesidades por la que atravesaron sus padres.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, panificados, alimentos no perecederos y demás para abastecer su local comercial, sabe que esto le servirá para atraer a más clientes. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Sra. Pabla is 41 years old. She has been married to Sr. José, age 46, for 22 years. They have seven children.

Sra. Pabla is a merchant and operates a food pantry out of her home. Her husband has an automobile that he uses for his job as a traveling vendor. He sells clothing, shoes, and sewing supplies in the surrounding areas. They have worked in this manner for 15 years.

Pabla started her business with great sacrifice, using the small amount of savings that she had. She was able to prosper because she wanted to proviD. a decent life for her children. Pabla is able to offer them the necessities that she lacked when she was their age.

She is requesting a loan to buy food products, baked goods, nonperishable goods, and other items to restock her store. Pabla knows that this will help her attract more customers. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy food products, baked goods, nonperishable goods, and other items.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 42 años, es soltero pero tiene 2 hijos, con quienes viven en su casa que es propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. José es un gran hombre, desde aun muy pequeño fue abandonado por sus padres pero eso no le detuvo y solo se forjo como un hombre emprendedor, hoy posee un negocio, que es un bar y con centros de entretenimiento. de esa manera podrá darle a sus 2 pequeños una buena educación, alimentación y vestido. Además cuenta con la ayuda de sus sobrinos quienes lo facilitan en la atención a sus clientes. El único inconveniente que tiene es que su local no es tan amplio y desearía a futuro contar con un local en mejores condiciones, es por esta razón que visita las oficinas de MFP para solicitar un crédito, donde fue atendido de una manera cordial. Este es su primer crédito por lo que el se compromete en efectivizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles ampliará y amueblará su local.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old.  He is single but has two children who he lives with in his own home.  His home is located in Pichari district.

José is a great man.  He was abandoned by his parents when he was still very young but this didn't stop him and he shaped himself into an entrepreneurial man.  He now owns his own business which is a bar with entertainment center.  In this way, he is able to provide his two young children with a good education, food and clothes.  He also has the support of his nephews who help him to serve his customers.  The only problem that José has is that his premises are not big enough and he would like, in the future, to have better premises.  For this reason, he visited MFP's offices to request a loan.  There he was served in a friendly manner. 

This is José's first loan and he pledges to make his loan repayments on time.  He will use his 1,500 soles to expand and furnish his premises.

loans.use: to expand his premises and buy furniture

loans.name: Mwaduna

texts.en:
Mwaduna is a married man with five children, three boys and two girls. Three of his children attend school while two are still too young for school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. Mwaduna faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during the harvesting period when the demand for products is lower. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Islomkhon

texts.ru: Предприниматель Исломхон занимается  этим бизнесом уже 5 лет. Он занимается продажей парфюмерных изделий  на центральном рынке. Он приобретает товар с другого рынка города. Ему в бизнесе помогает его сестра. У Исломхона на иждивении 6 человек. Он старается хорошо обслуживать клиентов, поэтому  бизнес у него развивается и у него много постоянные клиенты. Исломхон хочет расширить бизнес для большего развития бизнеса и просит займ в размере 800$ США. Исломхон надеется на Вашу помощь и благодарит Вас.
texts.en: Entrepreneur Islomkhon has been running his business for the last five years. He sells cosmetics and body care products at the central market. He purchases his goods from other markets in the city. Islomkhon's sister helps him at the store and the two of them are able to support six family members. Islomkhon strives to take the very best care of his customers so his business is doing well and he has a lot of regular clients. Now Islomkhon wants to expand his business and asks for a loan of 800 US dollars. He hopes you will assist him and thanks in advance for your help.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Kebon Bawang 3 Group

texts.en:
Rini has been selling clothes on credit for four years. She wants to now start selling electronics on credit. Rini is 37 years old and married with three children. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She hopes she can increase her customers and her profits by switching to the electronics business. She uses the income from her business to help pay the school fees for her children. Her hope for her family is that someday they will have enough money to build a house.

Rini is pictured standing in the middle back wearing a purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy electronics to resell on credit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: María Ceferina

texts.es:
La  Señora Maria  tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, vive en  la Comunidad del Triunfo de la Cruz en  el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida
Sus hijos están casados y viven por separado en sus hogares. Doña Maria vive sola y se dedica al negocio de pulpería donde vende granos básicos (maíz, arroz y frijoles), lácteos, golosinas, refrescos y productos de higiene personal.
El negocio lo inicio una de las hijas y posteriormente se lo cedió a ella. Para poder surtir  la pulpería ella solicitó un préstamo pequeño.
En esta temporada, ella ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para abastecer su negocio con productos de primera necesidad, con lo que espera ampliar sus ventas y obtener mayores utilidades.
Considera que su negocio le ha proporcionado estabilidad económica y espera poder terminar de construir su vivienda y reparar el local de su negocio con material de concreto.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old.  She is a single mother, and she has five children,  She lives in the Triunfo de la Cruz community in the Tela municipality, Atlántida.  Her children are married and live separately in their homes.  Maria lives alone.

She has a grocery store where she sells basic grains (corn, rice, beans), dairy products, sweets, soft drinks, and personal hygiene products.  One of her daughters started the business, and she later gave it to Maria.  She requested a small loan in order to stock the grocery store.

At this time she has requested a new loan to stock her store with basic needs products.  By doing so she hopes to increase her sales and get greater profits.

She feels that her business has provided her with financial stability.  She hopes to be able to finish building her house and to repair her place of business with concrete.

loans.use: to buy products (basic grains, sweets, and soft drinks).

loans.name: Duo Colibri De San Bartolo Group

texts.es: Historia duo colibri de san bartolo: doña oti se ha dedicado desde ya hace dos años a la venta de huevos,  ya que el tiempo esta muy difícil y para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa se decidió a comprar y vender huevos al principio comenzó con 2 cajas de huevo a la semana hoy nos comenta que se compra 6 cajas a la semana y viaja a diario al mercado  que es ahí donde los vende, y necesita el credito para compra de huevos por mayor ya que por mayor se lo dan mas barato.al igual que la siguiente socia tambien esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas sus negocio.
texts.en:
History of Duo Colibri De San Bartolo: Oti has sold eggs for two years now, as she is facing hard economic times and in order to help her husband with family expenses, she decided to buy and sell eggs. She started out with 2 egg cartons a week and now says she buys 6 cartons a week. She travels each day to the market, where she sells the eggs.

She needs the loan to buy eggs from wholesalers, as this is the cheapest way she can get them. the other partner is also requesting this loan to buy products to increase her business' supply.

loans.use: to buy eggs for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old and lives in Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Efraim, a foam vendor, and is the mother of four children.  Two of her children have jobs, one is in college, and the youngest is in elementary school.
