Gloria owns a small general store where she sells items such as canned food, condiments, milk, sugar, and everday household goods. Her store is adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and others in her community. She says she has a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.  Gloria plans to use this 10,000 PHP loan to buy more inventory for her store.  She wishes that her business will continue to grow.

Gloria hopes that she will be able to continue paying for her children's education and that they will able to finish their studies. She wants them to enjoy a good life.  She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to learn a lot from the Bible.  The word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned food, condiments, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past twelve years, Alice has been working hard to manage her vegetable stall, which sells different kinds of fresh produce. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables to sell in the market. It will help Alice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another stall. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lemashon

texts.en:
Lemashon, 26 years old, is single and supports his parents. He has been running a retail shop for the last seven years. 

Lemashon knew about KADET through other clients registered in his area. This will be his second loan with KADET. He intends to spend it by buying more stock, such as sugar, tea leaves, flour, soft drinks, etc. for his shop.

Lemashon plans to reinvest the anticipated profits generated from this loan back into the  business. He dreams of becoming a wholesaler in the future. Lemashon can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the shop

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, 31, is married and has two children. She lives in the Philippines.

Ester is operating a business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years and she earns 2,500 a month from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to repair her existing vehicle so she can provide better service.

In 2010, Ester joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Ester hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Alba Elizabeth

texts.es: Alba, solicita otro préstamo para seguir trabajando en su negocio y comprara materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas: maíz, gas, bolsas y lo utilizara para la reparación de la plancha que utiliza para su negocio, con el propósito de tener lo necesario para atender mejor a su clientela y mejorar en su produccion. Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo porque el negocio siempre es muy rentable y ha mejorado la situación económica cada día y su familia está estable.
texts.en:
Alba is requesting another loan in order to continue working in her business.  She will buy raw materials; corn, gas, and bags; to make tortillas.  She will use the loan to repair the griddle that she uses for her business.  Her objective is to have what she needs to improve service and production for her customers.

She believes that the previous loan helped her because her business is always very profitable.  It has improved her financial situation every day, and her family is stable.

loans.use: to repair the griddle and to buy corn, gas, and bags.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a fish vending business. She sells various types of fresh fish. She has been selling fish for more than 10 years now.

Due to lack of financial capacity, Adelaida requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy various fresh fish to resell. In the future, Adelaida  would like to expand her fish vending business to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes, maize and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.en:
I work taking photos of events and of people, also for passports and kin. I have 5 years experience and in my community, I am contracted to cover events such as reunions, parties or press events. My business is family owned and operated, but I have two young assistants who help me take photos and develop them. I like to take photos and thanks to this job, I am able to work to support my family.

Loan Use: Buying rolls of film, cameras, photographic paper and other items.

Me dedico a tomar fotografias de eventos y personas, tambien para pasaportes y carne. Tengo mas de 5 años de experiencia y en mi comunidad me contratan para cubrir eventos en reuniones, fiestas o ruedas de prensa. Mi negocio es familiar pero tengo 2 jovenes que me ayudan a tomar fotografias y revelarlas. Me gusta tomar fotos y gracias a este trabajo he podido apoyar a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de rollos fotograficos, camaras, papel para fotos y otros.

loans.name: Samuel & Dorcas

texts.en: Samuel N. is married and a father of 3 daughters in primary school. He runs a clothing shop with his wife Dorcas, and they have been good supporters of PEMCI right from inception. This is his fourth loan with PEMCI. His first two loans of US$715 and the third of US$1450 were paid in a timely manner. He has moved from vending clothes to being a wholesaler. This fourth loan of US$1450 will be used to grow his business further. His wife would also like to sell ladies’ shoes in line with the clothing business. We are proud of what this couple has achieved in a very short time with us, and we have no doubt that they will go a long way with PEMCI. Their ambition is to establish a good foundation for the education of their 3 daughters.

loans.use: Stock the shop

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok I. is 57 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She is the mother of five children, but her husband recently passed away, leaving her to take care of the family.  I. raises chickens and ducks, which she sells at the local market.  Her business typically generates about $12 in revenue per day.  To supplement the family’s income, her children also work.  One raises pigs, which he sells to a butcher at the market.  Another helps I. to raise the chickens and brings them to the market to sell.  A third child is a motorcycle taxi driver in the village.  Her other two children are still in school.  Sok I. hopes to use this loan to buy more chickens, which she will raise for her business.  In the future, she hopes to open a store at the market where she will sell her chickens directly to consumers (at retail price).

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business

loans.name: Gulbuta

texts.en:
Gulbuta is a mother of 3 children. She is 50 years old,  an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
6 years ago she decided to start her own business. She has raised cattle.
Now she requests a loan of $950 to purchase a pregnant cow. She plans to increase the number of her cows to improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
When I got married, my husband was working in a tire-shop. Over the years, we took out loans and he opened up his own tire-shop. Our income has been steadily increasing, as his business is doing well. We are able to send our two children to a private school, where the standard of education is better than in the public schools. My husband would like to expand his business now and we require a loan to purchase more tires and other accessories.

Nasreen N., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase tires for our tire-shop

loans.name: Ni Nengah Nuitri

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Nuitri, 56 years old lives in Manistutu, a village in West Bali, where most inhabitants profession are tenant farmers. So is Ni Nengah Nuitri profession. The last few months the weather was in a quite long dry season, so that farm produce was down. But living expenses increase. As a Balinese woman, and a good mother, Ni Nengah Nuitri quickly grasp the situation. To support from not so good economic condition, Ni Nengah Nuitri covered it from her pig farming business. The loan would be used to buy a mother pig. She has been in this business since getting married, and she is still on it. Ni Nengah Nuitri wants to change her life, as mopther and wife. Ni Nengah Nuitri won't only depend on her husband's income. Ni Nengah Nuitri wants to increase her living standard as a woman or wife. With her pig farming business, Ni Nengah Nuitri has her own income to support family expenses. Her husband is also supportive at her business venture.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nengah Nuitri, 56 tahun, tinggal di desa Manistutu, sebuah desa di Bali barat yang sebagian besar penduduknya berprofesi sebagai petani. Demikian juga yang dikerjakan oleh Ni Nengah Nuitri. Beberapa bulan terakhir, kondisi cuaca didaerah ini mengalami musim kering yang cukup panjang sehingga mengakibatkan penurunan dari hasil pertanian. Sedangkan biaya hidup semakin tinggi. Sebagai seorang wanita Bali dan ibu rumah tangga yang baik, Ni Nengah Nuitri cepat tanggap akan situasi itu. Untuk menunjang dari situasi ekonomi yang kurang baik, Ni Nengah Nuitri menutupinya dengan penghasilannya dari beternak babi. Pinjaman yang diperolehnya digunakan untuk membeli induk babi. Usaha ini sudah ditekuninya sejak ia menikah dulu. Kegiatan ini tetap dilakukannya, karena Ni Nengah Nuitri mempunyai semangat untuk merubah hidupnya, baik sebagai ibu rumah tangga atau sebagi istri. Ni Nengah Nuitri tidak ingin hanya meminta mengandalkan pendapatan suaminya untuk keperluan hidup berkeluarga. Ni Nengah Nuitri ingin mengangkat derajat hidupnya sebagi seorang wanita atau istri. Dengan usaha ternak babi yang kini ditekuninya, Ni Nengah Nuitri mempunyai penghasilan sendiri yang dapat menunjang penghasilan keluarganya. Suaminya pun sangat mendukungnya atas usaha yang dilakukannya.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig

Membeli induk babi

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.es:
Eustaquia is a hard working woman. Early each day she gets ready to go to the agricultural fields she works with her husband, carrying her tools for working the land with the help of her little friend, Silverio. They raise potatoes, root vegetables, corn and broadbeans; additionally, they herd a few small animals. The work is difficult and requires much dedication and strength.

Eustaquia is the mother of four children. The oldest daughter is married and the younger children study; for this reason her goal is to keep working. Now that it is planting season, the days are more exhausting. Her family hopes that this harvest is successful, because a year ago extreme cold considerably damaged their harvest and caused numerous losses, making it impossible for them to meet all their needs. However, her courage and perseverance pushed her to continue with her activities, and their means of support during this time was the sale of their animals.

For Estaquia, the land is a way of life and each day she thanks God for what they receive from it. She wants to keep working and that is why she is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers for their land. Please support this woman who lives simply but has a tremendous will to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Eustaquia, es una mujer muy trabajadora; todos los días desde muy temprano se alista para dirigirse a sus campos de cultivo junto a su esposo, llevando con ayuda de su amiguito Silverio sus herramientas para labrar la tierra; ellos cultivan papa, olluco, maíz y habas adicionalmente pastan algunos animalitos. Este trabajo es arduo debido a que requiere de mucha dedicación y fortaleza.

Eustaquia es madre de cuatro hijos, la mayor ya está casada y los menores aún estudian, por esta razón se ha planteado la meta de seguir trabajando y ahora que es época de siembra los días son más agotadores y su familia espera que esta cosecha sea muy provechosa porque hace un año la implacable fuerza del frío perjudicó considerablemente su cosecha y les ocasionó cuantiosas perdidas imposibilitando la satisfacción plena de sus necesidades; sin embargo su esfuerzo y perseverancia la impulsaron a continuar con sus actividades y su sostén durante las épocas de pérdida agrícola fue la venta de ganado.

Para ella el campo es su forma de vida y agradece a Dios por la provisión diaria que recibe. Desea seguir trabajando y es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de abono para sus tierras.Apoyemos a una mujer de humilde de corazón y condición con enormes fuerzas para triunfar.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers to insure success for the next harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her inventory (Incrementar su inventario)

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Ms. Tomasa belongs to the “Nuevo Horizonte” Communal Bank and lives in Jr. Cusco Mz. H Lt. 6 of the Calleria district in the Ucayali department. She is 46 years old, married and mother of two little children. Her husband is an administrator. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she started her sheet sewing shop.

She is presently running her shop and has several overlockers. She gets up daily at 6am to make breakfast for her kids and husband, to then work in the manufacture of sheets. In order to meet the demands of her clients, she often works until very late at night.

With the current loan of 1000 soles, to be repaid in five months, she will buy fabrics, elastic, threads, needles, silk lace, as well as give maintenance to her overlock machines, which are her work tools.

Tomasa has greater independence and feels calmer. Furthermore, her family is very happy for her and for all the achievements she has attained thanks to the support received from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tomasa pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Horizonte, vive en Jr. Cusco Mz. H Lt. 6 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es administrador. Tomasa, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide implementar su taller de costura de sábanas.

En la actualidad ella continúa con el taller, cuenta con varias remalladoras, se levanta a las 6 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y su esposo, luego se dedica a la confección de las sábanas, pues a diario tiene que cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes, muchas veces se queda hasta tardes horas de la noche para acabar con los pedidos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, ella comprará telas, elásticos, hilos, blondas, agujas, además de dar mantenimiento a su máquina remalladora, que es su herramienta de trabajo.

Tomasa es más independiente, se siente más tranquila, su familia esta muy feliz por ella y por todo los logros que está alcanzando gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials (fabrics, elastics, threads, needles, etc).

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 44 years old and a father of 3. Mohamad lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is a curtain tailor. This is the third time Mohamad has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He needs to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: Shamim A. is the leader of this group, and she is from Depalpur, a small metropolis in Pakistan. She is married and a mother of nine, two of whom are married. Her husband trades livestock and also sells milk. Now, they would like to purchase more sheep, for which they need a loan. A few other women who have joined her in this group are: Rukkiah B., whose husband operates a food stall and a juice counter; Razia B., who wants to improve her family's farming practises; and Balqees N., who wants to buy electric goods for her husband’s electrical goods store.  All of these women practice values such as punctuality and cooperation, as well as exhibit an attitude of responsibility.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan from Kiva of $825.00.

loans.use: To buy a few more sheep.

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun Y., age 30,  lives in Kampong Cham province, where she and her husband work growing rice in both the rainy and dry seasons making, on average, $3 a day.  They have three children, one of whom is a student while the other two are Y. too young to attend school.


Choeun is requesting a loan to purchase wood to repair their house, as the roof leaks during the rainy season. In the near future, she plans to raise chickens and ducks for the eggs. (Picture: husband, wife and small son)

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Komla Samuel

texts.fr:
Born June 16th, 1980 in Bolou Agbadomé in the Zio Prefecture, Mr. Komla Samuel A. wasn’t lucky enough to move on in his studies. Very early on he launched himself in the poultry farming business. He has been very successful at this. He is seeking a loan which will serve to construct a chicken coop and to buy one day-old chicks. With this loan he believes he will become self sufficient, will increase his sales and thus his income in order to take responsibility for his brothers and sisters still living with his parents, and to contribute to improving his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 16 juin 1980 à Bolou Agbadomé (P/Zio), Monsieur A. Komla Samuel n'a pas eu la chance d'avancer dans les etudes.Mais tres tot il s'est lance dans l'elevage des poulets.Ce qui lui reussit tres bien. il sollicite un crédit qui servira à construire le poulailler et à acheter les poussins d’un jour d’âge. Avec ce crédit il pense s’auto suffir, augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus pour prendre en charge ses fières et sœurs toujours à la charge de leurs parents et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Construction of a chicken coop and purchase of chicks for breeding

loans.name: Joyce S.

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33 year-old Joyce F..  She is married, and has two children ages 8 and 14. She has two other dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.  In 2005, Joyce  established her genge business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Joyce  requires a loan in order to buy oil,tomatoes,salt,fish,soaps,sugar and rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy oil,tomatoes,salt,fish,soaps,sugar and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Hojar

texts.ru:
Hojar K., 42, lives in Khuroson district. She and her husband have four children. Hojar is a trained nurse and works in Khuroson district's local clinic. Hojar would like to keep a cow at home to provide milk for her family. She has saved up some money to buy a cow, but since prices have gone up, Hojar has decided to apply for a loan so she can buy the cow as soon as possible. She plans to repay her loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Ходжар жительница района Хуросон. Возраст 42 года, замужем , имеет 4 детей. По специальности медицинская сестра. Работает в местной поликлинике района Хуросон.В данное время у клиентки нет в доме дойной коровы, которая давала бы молоко. У Ходжар есть свои денежные сбережения на которые она хотела бы купить дойную корову для своей большой семьи.Но цены на сельхозживотные выросли и она решила взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Kawral 2 Group

texts.fr: Le village de GOUY GUI a longtemps polarisé les activités socio économiques de la communauté rurale de DENDEY ; mais avec les multiples années de sécheresse et les conséquences de la désertification, le cercle de la pauvreté s’est beaucoup élargi et a basculé les populations dans une  précarité très prononcée. L'objectif de ce renouvellement du prêt est de participer à la création de nouvelles ressources financières au bénéfice des membres en développant des activités de petit commerce inter-villageois avec les produits locaux. La stratégie repose sur la capacité du groupement à acheter et stocker assez de matière première pour constituer un fond de roulement et satisfaire la demande au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires, des communautés rurales voisines. Il s’agira d’acheter  de la matière première au moment où le prix est très bas, de la stocker, puis organiser la redistribution pendant toute l’année. Les produits alimentaires seront privilégiés dans la commercialisation.
texts.en:
For many years, the village of Gouygui has been a socio-economic centre for the rural community of Dendy. However, due to multiple years of drought as well as the effects of desertification, the circle of poverty has greatly increased and has thrown this population into precarious conditions. With the renewal of this loan, the goal will be to create new financial resources for community members who develop small inter-village businesses selling local products. The strategy rests upon the ability of the group to purchase and stock enough raw materials to create a working capital and to satisfy the demand of the weekly markets in the neighbouring rural communities. They will have to purchase raw materials when the price is very low, stock the materials, then organise the redistribution of these materials throughout the year. Food products will be given priority in this business.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase and resale of food products

loans.name: Phall

texts.en: Mrs. Phall S. lives in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer but the soil in her rice field is poor. Therefore, Mrs. Phall S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her crop. She is a 48-year-old widow with three children one of whom owns a small grocery store in the local market while the other two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham.  Every day, she works alongside her husband in their restaurant selling wine, beer, and many kinds of meat, and earns about $10.  Sam believes that their restaurant would attract more customers and therefore earn more profit if they offered a wider selection of beers and wines.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1000, which will be used to expand the refreshments available at her family's restaurant.

loans.use: To increase the selection of drinks for sale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Solidaridad (“Solidarity”) Village Bank.  She is 60 years old, married and has nine children.  She has a business selling meat.  She buys the animals at the city’s Sunday livestock fair, slaughters them at her home, and sells the meat from house to house on credit.  She collects payment from her clients each week.  She also makes yarn from sheep’s wool, which she sells by the kilo. 

Hilda needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy pigs and sheep. 

Hilda’s dreams are to expand her business, to offer a wider variety of products, to open another business and to dedicate herself to agriculture.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Hilda es casada, tiene 60 años y 9 hijos, Hilda venD. carne, los animales los adquiere en la feria D. animales D. la ciudad los días domingos, luego lo beneficia en su casa y lo venD. D. casa en casa al crédito y cobra semanalmente. Además Hilda se dedica al hilado D. lana D. oveja que luego venD. por kilos.
Hilda necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerdo, oveja.
Los sueños D. Hilda son ampliar su negocio, surtir mas, tener otro negocio y dedicarse a la agricultura.

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep

loans.name: Chimnaz

texts.en:
In the picture you can see Chimnaz, who bakes very delicious cakes. She is married and has 2 children. She lives in Khachmaz.She was born in 1965 and 4 years ago, she started this business.

Chimnaz bakes cakes for sale. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy butter, flour and necessary things for baking the tasty cakes.

loans.use: to buy butter, flour  and other necessary things for baking cakes

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex tiene 25 años, es casado y vive con su joven familia. Se dedica a la crianza de animales, los cuales vende después de haberlos engordado y criado por una temporada, esta actividad lo acompaña por 5 años, siendo éstos, los años donde tiene la satisfacción de trabajar en una labor no tan pesada, sino de cuidado para con los animales, en cuanto a sus vacunas y alimentación, necesarias para su crecimiento. En el caso de sus vaquitas puede obtener una ganancia adicional, ya que vende la leche que producen en los mercados o a sus vecinos. Alex quiere ir creciendo poco a poco, sin apresurarse en tomar decisiones precipitadas, quiere seguir vendiendo sus propios animales y leche, evitando a los intermediarios mayoristas. Este es su 5 préstamo con MFP, y gracias a los préstamos obtenidos ha tenido la oportunidad de crecer considerablemente, es por ello que está muy agradecido y su compromiso con sus pagos lo mantiene firmemente. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá una vaca de mejor raza, la cual tiene un valor de 1500 soles, saldo que él aumentará a la cantidad solicitada.
texts.en:
Alex is 25 years old, married and lives with his young family. He works raising animals, which he sells once he has fattened and raised them for a while, and has done so for five years. In these years, he has had the satisfaction of working in a job that is not too heavy, caring for the animals by providing the vaccines and nutrition necessary for their growth. His small cows can bring additional income, as he sells the milk they produce in markets or to his neighbors. Alex wants to keep growing little by little, without rushing into hasty decisions. He wants to keep selling his own animals and milk, avoiding middlemen. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and thanks to the loans he's obtained, he's had the opportunity to grow considerably. For this, he is very grateful and maintains firmly his commitment to repayment. With this loan he will acquire a better breed of cow, valued at 1500 soles, which is why he requests a greater amount.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a better breed of cow

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мирзоева Мухаббат жительница города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 50 лет. ивет со своей семьей. Она замужем и у нее пятеро детей. Домохозяйка , занимается земледелием. Планирует получить кредит для посева. Купить на полученные деньги семена пшеницы и удобрения. Погасить креди сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhabbat M. is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and five children in Tursunzade. Muhhabat is a homemaker and works in agriculture. She would like to get a loan that would allow her to buy seeds and fertilizers. She would pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Las Primaveras Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Primaveras" esta  representado por la señora Deysi y compuesto por 17 miembros los cuales se encuentran cursando su segundo ciclo con la fundación agrocapital en la cual demostraron seriedad, responsabilidad y puntualidad con sus obligaciones.  Las integrantes en su mayoría se dedican a la producción y venta D. alimentos o comida rápida como ser sanduwish, empanadas, comida, carne y productos como cosméticos, carteras y a actividades como ser trabajadora del hogar. Como en todo rubro siempre existe la competencia pero las ganas D. trabajar D. las socias es lo que las saca adelante y les impulsa a ser mejores cada día. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos y materiales para incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida. Dentro D. su anterior ciclo demostraron responsabilidad tanto en grupo como individualmente.
texts.en:
The " Las Primaveras" group, represented by Mrs. Deysi, has 17 members. They are requesting their second loan from the communal bank and have always demonstrated determination, responsibility and punctuality with regards to making their payments. The majority of the group's members dedicate themselves to the production and sale of food or snacks, like groceries, sandwiches and empanadas. Other members sell cosmetics, notebooks, or work in their homes. Like most people, they are capable and competent but what really sets them apart is their work ethic and their desire to better themselves every day. They will use this loan to buy ingredients and primary materials for their food and their products, in order to increase their earnings and be able to improve their families' quality of life. They have always been very responsible about their loans, both as a group and as individuals.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna N. is a group leader of four, all of whom live in Kdol village in Takeo province. She is a rice seller and her husband, Mr. Meas Touch, is employed in a garment factory as an administrator. The couple have five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a beautician who is hired by the local people for wedding ceremonies, parties, and so on. Their other three children are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Vanna N. is applying for a loan to buy more cosmetic supplies to support her second child's beauty salon business.

One group member’s loan is end-of-term and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term (EoT) loan does not require payment on the principal loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, as it allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic supplies to support her second child's beauty business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías trabaja como promotor de venta de hormigones pretensazos además  esta venciendo el ultimo año de la carrera de técnico en electricidad vive solo con su mama y vive en casa propia ubicada en la calle Emiliano Gómez de la zona de Complementación Yunguyo de la ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de material de contracción ladrillo, cemento, arena que le servirá para la construcción de una habitación.

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Elías is a sales promoter of prestressed concrete. He is also completing the last year of his studies as an electrical repairman. He lives alone with his mother in his own house located on Emiliano Gómez street in the Complementación Yunguyo zone of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase contracting materials, brick, cement, sand, that will serve in the construction of a house. This is his first loan with Impro, the evaluation conducted qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS

loans.name: Amonboy

texts.ru: Амонбою 51 год. Он женат и имеет 6-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. У них есть несколько дойных коров. Она сдаёт молоко оптом на рынок городским торговцам. Так как у городских людей нет дома коровы, молоко им приходится покупать на рынке. Спрос молочных продуктов очень высокий. Амонбой старается увеличить количество своего скота, это принисет ему больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Amonboy is 51 years old. He is married and has six children. He completed secondary school. His wife processes and sells milk. They have several dairy cows, and she markets milk wholesale to vendors in town. Since the people living in town do not keep cows at home, they are obliged to purchase their milk at the market; the demand for milk products is high. Amonboy is trying to increase the size of his herd to bring in more profit.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Kuña Guapa De Caaguazu Group

texts.es:
Este comité  integrado por 16 Sras.  a diario trabajan ya que son las que llevan el dinero ganado con sus trabajos para mantener a sus familias, cada una tiene un oficio en donde invertir el préstamo  que la Fundación Paraguaya les brinda  les ayudara  a cada una para invertir en sus negocios y así poder tener mas ganancias.  

Este comite´denominado Kuña Guapa, está integrado con señoras que desean un cambio en sus vidas en lo personal y económico, es por eso que se unieron para conformar un grupo solidario con el fin de contar con una herramienta de trabajo que la fundación Paraguaya les otorga, que es un crédito activo para que ellas hagan un buen uso e inversión en sus oficios diarios, ellas  poseen las ganas de trabajar en grupo, tienen  espíritu emprendedor y por sobre todo las ganas de progresar, y tomar una responsabilidad  conjunta todas ellas.

Las integrantes son: 

Elizabeth G.	- Vendedora Ambulante, Vta. de frutas y verduras
Ramona E. Cañete 	 - Macatera vta. De ropas usadas
Blasia Antonia B.	 - Almacén
Edita B. de Orue	-  Vendedora Ambulante, vta. de mandioca
Mirian C. Benitez	 -  Venta de Frutas y Verduras
Julia R. Diaz	  -  Almacen
Marina R.	 - Macatera vta. De Ropas
Maria Silvia S.	-  Merceria Cotillon
Petrona O. de Morinigo	-  Vendedora ambulante De Verduras
Claudelina González	-  Macatera Vta. De Ropas
Pablina Ester F.	-  Macatera Vta. de cubiertos, utensilios para el hogar
Epifania C.	-  Vta. De Bijouterie
Claudelina C.	-  Macatera Vta. De ropas y perfumes
Cresencia M.	-  Vta. de Frutas y Verduras
Ramona B.	-  Modista
Dominga V.	-  Macatera vta. de utensilios para el hogar
texts.en:
This group is made up of 18 women who work every day, since they are the ones bringing in the money to support their families. The loans from Fundación Paraguaya help the members, each of whom has her own occupation, invest in their businesses so they can earn more income. The members of the Kuña Guapa (Guarani for Hard-Working Woman) group are women who want to make a change in their personal and economic lives. They joined together in a supportive group so they could obtain the tools of the trade that Fundación Paraguaya offers, namely loans that they can invest in their daily occupations. They have the desire to work in a group, enterprising spirits, and, above all, the desire to progress and take responsibility as a group. The members of the group are: Elizabeth G. – Traveling Sales – Fruits and Vegetables Ramona E. Cañete – Used Clothing Sales Blasia Antonia B. – Grocery Store Edita B. de Orue – Traveling Sales - Tapioca Mirian C. Benitez – Fruit and Vegetable Sales Julia R. Diaz – Grocery Store Marina R. – Clothing Sales Maria Silvia S. – Party Notions Petrona O. de Morinigo – Traveling Sales - Vegetables Claudelina González – Clothing Sales Pablina Ester F. – Sales – Cutlery and Utensils for the Home Epifania C. – Jewelry Sales Claudelina C. – Clothing and Perfume Sales Cresencia M. – Sales – Fruits and Vegetables Ramona B. - Dressmaker Dominga V. – Sales of Household Utensils

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: These merchants, saleswomen, and shopkeepers will use their loan to buy more merchandise to sell, including fruits, vegetables, cheese, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Aqsa Muhammad Imran Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Another Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. Fatima baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell.

Aqsa baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. They all lives in the historic city in Lahore named Yadgar, Pakistan. Aqsa baji is married to M. I. who runs a cosmetics selling business. He buys cosmetics from the famous market of Lahore city named "Shahalmi" at wholesale and sells to the cosmetics shops to earn an income.

Aqsa baji also runs a cloth selling business to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics to expand her husband's cosmetics selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Guid

texts.es: Guid tiene 49 años, vive con su hija de 8 años y su esposa, quien trabaja preparando y vendiendo comida. Desde muy joven se sintió atraído por el manejo de automóviles, es así que cuando se le dio la oportunidad de asociarse con un grupo de amigos y brindar servicio de taxi, no lo pensó dos veces y decidió arriesgarse. Felizmente todo le ha ido muy bien y ahora tienen 5 autos trabajando para ellos, en uno de los cuales él mismo trabaja. Comienza a las 9 de la mañana y termina a las 9 ó 10 de la noche para lograr los ingresos necesarios, su meta es obtener 100 soles diarios y trabaja hasta reunirlos. Asimismo, debe hacer el mantenimiento de su carro cada 15 días, donde gasta gran parte de sus ganancias. Guid es muy trabajador y quiere seguir progresando, es por ello que en para el futuro le gustaría tener una gran flota de taxis y convertirse en un empresario del transporte. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su auto, además de tramitar algunas licencias que se han vencido.
texts.en:
Guid is 49 years old and lives with his 8-year old daughter and his wife, who works preparing and selling food. Since he was very young, he felt attracted to driving cars. This is why when he was given the opportunity to associate with a group of friends and offer taxi services, he didn't think twice and decided to take the risk. Happily, everything went well and now they have five taxis, of which he drives one. He starts work at 9 in the morning and ends work at 9 or 10 at night in order to attain the salary he needs. His aim is to obtain 100 soles daily and he works until he earns that amount. At the same time, he needs to perform maintenance on his car every 15 days, which is where he spends a great part of his earnings. Guid is very hard-working and wants to continue progressing. For that reason, he would like to own a fleet of taxis and become a taxi businessman. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and he promises to be very punctual in his payments. With the money he is requesting, he will fix his car and take care of expired licenses.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his taxi

loans.name: Hamed

texts.en:
Hamed is a farmer from Nablus, Palestine. He is 22 years old and lives with his parents and two youngest brothers.

Hamed has a very small farm, but it suffices to cover the expenses of his family. He is hoping that, with this loan, he will be able to maximize the production of his fields.

Hamed promises to pay the loan back on time without any violation, and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To maximize the production of his fields

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Modesta es casada, tiene 60 años y 7 hijos, Modesta venD. artesanía en telar como frazadas, individuales, los cuales son mandados a elaborar con artesanos, sus ventas lo realiza a tiendas y también lo envía a Bolivia.
Modesta necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tejidos.
Los sueños D. Modesta son mejorar su negocio y vender sus productos en el extranjero.
texts.en:
Modesta is a member of the Santa Rita Communal Bank. She is married, 60 years old, and has seven children. Modesta sells artesan textile products such as blankets and place mats, which are ordered from craftspeople. Modesta sells her products in stores, and she also sends them to Bolivia. Modesta needs a loan of 800 soles to purchase fabrics. She dreams of improving her business and selling her products abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Nelida Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora NELIDA YESENIA S. M., tiene 41 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores de contabilidad, ejerció durante 8 años, pero al casarse se dedicó a su hogar y a estudiar la carrera técnica de costura, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 5 años quines depende económicamente de ella, porque aun se encuentran en el colegio.
NELIDA se dedica a la confeccion, venta y alquiler de disfraces en su domicilio.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertio en la compra telas, hilos, broches, cierres, sombreros, etc para elaborar sus disfraces.
Este crédito de 500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas materiales para la elaboración de sus disfraces
texts.en:
Nelida Yesenia Sánchez M. is 41 years old and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She belongs to Las Delicias II community bank. This entrepreneur completed 8 years of accounting college but after getting married decided to dedicate herself to her home and to studying dressmaking and tailoring. She has 2 children, ages 5 and 14, who are still in school and dependent on her. Nelida is a seamstress; she sells and rents costumes from her home. She used a loan of 300 PEN to buy cloth, thread, clasps, zippers, hats, etc. for producing costumes. This loan of 500 PEN will be used to buy more materials for making costumes.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make costumes.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina P. is from the village of Lao Sta Cruz. She is 39 years old. Melodina is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Melodina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melodina has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Melodina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melodina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Melodina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Melodina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital for her general store

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en:
B. Dolgormaa is 64 years old and lives with her grandson in Bayankhongor Province in central Mongolia. Her grandson is 16 years old and currently attends a local secondary school.

Dolgormaa operates a small meal service business out of her home. She prepares meals at her home and delivers them to her customers throughout her community. She started her meal service business in 2005 after retiring from a local school, where she taught for thirty-four years. Since then, her meal service has become popular in her community and she has many regular customers. She attributes her success to her good communication skills and honest, hardworking nature.

For Dolgormaa, family always comes first. She started her meal service business in order to support her grandson and hopes that he one day will attend university. She has also supported her two sons and a daughter-in-law with their student fees.

In the future, Dolgormaa wants to purchase an electric stove to help her increase the quality of her meals and the number of customers she can serve. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase food supplies, and an electric oven for her meal service business.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies and an electric oven

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is married and has six dependants. She has received schooling through senior high.   Elizabeth sells groceries like Milo milk sugar ECT at Elmina holy wood school, which she has been doing since 2004. Her husband is a fisherman.  Elizabeth uses her income to support the husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Subhan

texts.en: Subhan O. is married with four children. More than 15 years ago he observed that his neighborhood needed a grocery store, so he started one in order to improve his family's quality of life and offer his children a good education. Subhan started out selling basic necessities and little by little he has added more variety to his business. Today he offers a wide variety of products. He has grown his business with the help of his wife and children. In order to improve the quality of service and meet the demands of his customers, Subhan is now requesting a 1607 AZN loan which he will use to purchase merchandise. Please help this family improve their life by contributing to the growth of their business. They are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: purchase merchandize to increase income

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a 40 year-old woman. She is married and has two children who are attending school. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home. She is an achiever and a resourceful mother. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. For the last nine years, Yaa has traded in food such as plantains and cassava. She treks to surrounding villages in the community to purchase bulk stock of plantains from the farmers and sells to her customers.  Due to inadequate working capital, she is not able to purchase enough stock to make sufficient profit to support her family.  With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of plantains and cassava to enable her to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase bulk cassava and plantains.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: Cette dame réside dans le quartier de Ablogamé, qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle est mariée avec un enfant à sa charge. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de pagnes et de bazins. Son stock de marchandises a baissé, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner pour mieux vendre surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter  30 pagnes et 20 bazins.
texts.en:
This lady resides in Ablogamé, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé.  She is married and has one child in her care.  Her revenue-generating business involves selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and damask fabrics.  Her stock of merchandise is low.  She would like to stock up again to sell more, especially during the year-end holiday periods.  This is why she's requesting an initial loan from WAGES in order to buy 30 lengths of pagnes and 20 of damask. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en:
H. Zebiniso is 53 years old and married with two children of school age. As any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need and is dreaming that all of them will have a higher education.

Her husband is a farmer. Zebiniso is a farmer, too. She has been working the land for twenty years and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. She began cultivating her land through her own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. Zebiniso grows corn and onions. This business is one of her greatest accomplishments.

She wishes to continue to generate income for her children's development, and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 3,500 TJS. Zebiniso is planning to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. She thanks everyone who trusts her and supports her today. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma B. is from the city of Linao Norte, in Tuguegarao,Cagayan. She is 46 years old. Norma is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting peanuts for sale. Norma is just starting this business.

Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 28-year-old married man. Since 2005, he has owned a carpentry shop in his town and he is the one to support his family with this business. Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additional wood for his job.

loans.use: To buy additional wood

loans.name: Erick Daniel

texts.es: El señor Erick Daniel tiene negocio de peluquería unisex, el crédito lo ocupara para invertirlo en el mismo y poder da una mejor atención a su clientela que lo visita, el negocio lo inicio hace cinco años con capital propio donde solamente tenia un espejo y una silla ahora el negocio a crecido y a mejorado la estructura del local el crédito le beneficiara ya que asi seguirá mejorando su negocio y calidad de vida, el señor Erick es soltero pero tiene a su cargo a su abuelita que vive con el.
texts.en:
Erick Daniel’s business is a unisex beauty salon. He will use the loan to invest in his business to be able to give his customers better service. He started the business five years ago with his own money. He only had a mirror and a chair. Now the business has grown, and he has made improvements to his place. The loan will help him to keep improving his business and his quality of life. Erick is single, but he has the responsibility of his grandmother who lives with him.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Two revolving chairs, two meter mirror, a display case, and accessories

loans.name: Joesel

texts.en:
Joesel P., age 27, is from the village of Panay Diot Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Joesel is married and has a small child. To make a living, Joesel raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joesel has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Joesel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He wanted to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Most recently, Joesel has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Joesel is requesting a new loan amount of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Joesel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his rice-cultivation efforts

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena has one hectare of farmland that she wishes to harvest.  Last harvest, she managed to produce 80 sacks of rice.  She is aiming to produce the same, if not more this time around.  She also will use the loan to buy feed for her two female pigs who are both producing piglets.  She sells the piglets at the local market.  Elena really wants her two businesses to do well so that her two children can enjoy a good education.  Elena started borrowing in 2008 and is really grateful for the progress she has been able to see so far.

loans.use: Rice harvesting and pig feed

loans.name: Shahiqa Jan Group

texts.en:
Sultan M. is a member of the Shahiqa Jan group. He lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50, married, and has 3 children. He has got a cart, from which he sells cosmetics and runs a small business.
 
He needs this loan to purchase more, and different kinds of, cosmetics to increase his income and to support his family members in a better way. 
He hopes to grow his business and have a small shop in the future. He would like to mention that Kiva is a really effective process for entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his business.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en: Henrietta F. is from the village of Luinab, Iligan City. She is 48 years old, is widowed, and has five school-aged children. Henrietta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Henrietta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Henrietta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Luinab, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Janeth Natividad

texts.es:
El  Banco Comunal  Lomas del Viento está situado en  la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí, sus socias  son  un grupo de señoras  muy trabajadoras  y responsables donde se vive un ambiente de compañerismo, en nuestra vivista al banco comunal conversamos con la señora Janeth  S. que lleva como socia dos ciclos trabajando con la Fundación.

Janeth está casada desde hace cinco  años, tiene dos hijos su esposo se desempeña como chofer y ella al comercio informal de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, cuando nuestra socia empezó en las ventas  lo hizo con prendas intimas  y después fue surtiendo su stock hasta comercializar lo  ahora tiene.  Con este nuevo crédito  va  a comprar más mercadería como pantalones, blusas, camisas,  bermudas, etc. para damas, caballeros y niños y estas compras las realiza dos veces al mes.  Nuestra socia a sus  24 años  ha tenido que  combinar el tiempo entre el hogar,  sus hijos y el negocio, por eso en la mañana se dedica a la casa y en las tardes sale a recorrer su comunidad visitando a sus clientes que por lo general son del mismo sector donde vive.

El sueño de  Janeth es poder terminar sus estudios  en  belleza y cosmetología, así como  terminar de construir su casa propia y para ello está ahorrando sus ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
The Lomas del Viento Communal Bank is situated in the city of Portoviejo in the Manabí province. Its members are a group of women who are very hard-working and responsible. An atmosphere of collegiality exists among them. On our visit to the communal bank we spoke with Janeth S.. She has been a member working with the Fundación for two cycles. Janeth has been married for five years. She has two children, and her husband works as a driver. She sells clothing for women, men, and children. When she started in sales she sold intimate wear. Later, she was stocking up until she got the business where it is today. With this new loan she will buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts, and bermudas, etc. for women, men, and children. She makes these purchases twice a month. At her 24 years of age she has had to combine her time between her home, her children, and the business. In the mornings she takes care of her house, and in the afternoons she goes out into the community to visit her customers. They are generally from the same area in which she lives. Janeth’s dream is to be able to finish her beauty and cosmetic studies. She also dreams of finishing construction of her own house. She is saving her earnings from her business to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, blouses, shirts, and bermudas, etc. for women, men, and children

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Composé de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Danaya sont toutes des femmes mariées qui vivent en majorité dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, co-épouses, frères, sœurs et enfants. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 4 enfants. Ces femmes résident dans le village de Kangaré, région de Sikasso république du Mali. 
Par des relations  professionnelle et de mariage ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de céréales (telle le riz), de condiments alimentaires, de cosmétiques, de chaussures, de pagnes wax, brodés etc. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire et mieux satisfaire la clientèle, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Les précédents n’ont pas l’objet de mauvais remboursement. 
Madame Salimata D., qui est la présidente du groupe et qui est dans l’alimentaire veut acheter avec son prêt,  200kg de graine de dah, 150kg de graine de Néré, 100kg de graine d’arachide et 200kg de maïs. Tous ces produits sont achetés auprès des fournisseurs dans le village de Kangaré pour être revendus ensuite dans le grand marché hebdomadaire de Dalabala et journalier de Sélingué, en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle compte obtenir un bénéfice de 30.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé selon elle dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of four women, all of them married, who live mainly in traditional extended polygamous families, with their husbands, other wives, brothers, sisters, and children. On the average, they are 25 years old and have for children. They live in the village of Kangaré, in the Sikasso region of Mali. They know each other through family and business ties. They sell cereals (such as rice), food condiments, cosmetics, wax and embroidered "pagnes" [traditional fabrics for wrap clothing] etc. With the goal of increasing their income and better meeting customer demand in mind, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their fifth group loan. All previous loans were repaid without any issues. Mrs. Salimata D., who is the group leader and who is in the food business, would like to purchase with this loan 200kg [440 lbs] of "dah" [the local variety of hibiscus] grain, 150 kg [330 lbs] of the "néré" seeds [a West African plant whose seeds are used in a condiment], 100 kg [220 lbs] of peanuts and 200kg [440 lbs] of corn. All these products are purchased from the producers in the village of Kangaré and then resold at the big weekly market in Dalabala and the daily market in Sélingué, at the retail level, for cash, to a customer base composed essentially of women. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 30,000 West African Francs, which, according to her, will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cereals [for resale]

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa D., 40, is a widow and lives with her 13-year-old daughter in an apartment in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia.

Ariunaa operates a men’s and women’s clothing and underwear trading business at a rented counter at a local market. She has been operating her business since 1997, and has steadily expanded her business over the past thirteen years. She purchases her products 1-2 times a month, depending on her product sales. Since she started her business, her family's living conditions have been improving.

Ariunaa has good communication skills and has many plans for the future. She says, “I have a goal to save money from now to be financially able to pay my daughter's university tuition fees after she graduates from high school. In addition, I will work hard and use all of my abilities in order to purchase an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, because my daughter will study there in university.”

Ariunaa is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a variety of summer clothing from Ereen, a Chinese border town, to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of summer clothing

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, de produits cosmétiques, d’ustensiles de cuisine etc.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont à leur septième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des habillements, des ustensiles de cuisine et des produits cosmétiques.                                                                          
ATOU D. s’approvisionne en produits au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  22 500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Sabougnouman group are all married. They are on average 31 years old with four children, and all live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana, in the Dioïla Prefecture, part of the Koulikoro Region ( 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They were acquainted through family ties and are vendors of clothing, beauty products, kitchen utensils, etc. The women in the Sabougnouman group are now requesting their seventh group loan which will serve to buy clothing, kitchen utensils and beauty products. Atou D. resupplies her products in Burkina Faso and sells locally or in area market fairs, for cash or credit, to both men and women customers. She hopes to reach average monthly earnings of 22,500 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan, take care of health-related expenses, pay for food and schooling costs, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina es conviviente y tiene un hijo pequeño, vive en casa alquilada y su mayor sueño es tener casa propia. Celina junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de trapeadores de Yute, el material lo adquieren en la ciudad de Lima, su capacidad de producción es de 3 docenas de trapeadores por día, sus ventas los realiza repartiendo a las tiendas y de acuerdo a sus pedidos. Además tienen una mototaxi con el cual su esposo realiza transporte de pasajeros. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de telas e hilos.
Celina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro.
Los sueños de Celina son comprar un carro para que su esposo trabaje y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Celina is in a common law marriage and has a young son. She lives in a rented house, but her greatest dream is to have one of her own. Celia and her husband manufacture mops made of jute. They acquire their materials from the city of Lima. Their production capacity is three dozen mops per day.

Celina sells and delivers her products to stores based on orders. They also own a motorcycle taxi that her husband drives in order to provide passenger transportation services. Her loan will be used to buy fabrics and thread.

Celina is a member of the Communal Bank “Buena Suerte” (Good Luck). What she likes most is having the incentive to save. Her dreams include buying a car for her husband to use for work and building a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai T. is a middle-aged woman and is the mother of two children, both of whom go to school or work. In order to support her family, Thai T. sells a few grocery items out of her home. She began doing this a year ago and earns approximately $3 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who shown in the photo above. He is a domestic farmer who owns a machine that he uses to pick rice for fees. Thai T. has two hectares of farmland where she and her husband want to plant potatoes to make extra income but don’t have the capital to do so. Because she doesn't have money, Thai T. decided to request a loan to buy farm supplies for her field. Additionally, she hopes to enlarge her grocery business with any remaining cash from the loan.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and to enlarge her grocery business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita F. is from Barangay Bone South in Aritao Nueva Vizcaya. She is 52 years old and married with 5 adult children. To make a living, Teresita  runs a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI and is now requesting a second loan, for 8000 PHP, to expand her shop's product offering.

About ASKI:  ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her shop's product offering.

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa K. is a 32-year-old fish vendor in Bamburi Kwa Bulo, Mombasa. She is married to Stephen Runya, who works as a driver. K. has two children, ages twelve and four. 

This will be Mwanahawa's second loan from KADET, and she plans to use it to purchase more fish as stock to sell. She also hopes to use the anticipated profit to purchase a fish box.

She hopes to succeed in life through subsequent loans from KADET micro-finance.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 31 years old. Jerry is married and has one child. He is involved in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice for more than 5 years now. He also grows hogs for fattening and sale. Jerry is working hard to improve his business. He says he wants to have a stable income so he can also sustain the growing needs in his household.

Jerry joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerry has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jerry is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and feed for the pigs. This will be the third loan taken out by Jerry from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been farming for forty years and has employed one farmhand. His main products are milk and maize, which he sells at a local market. He is 67 years old and is married with 10 children who are all adults. Two of the children attend school.

Gabriel has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children. He aspires to acquire four more dairy cows in five years' time.

His primary challenges are lack of constant labour and lack of feeds, due to unpredictable supply and prices. He is grateful to Juhudi for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 44 years old. She has three children and her husband is a driver. Her children are ages 8, 10 and 20. Eugine sells used clothes and needs a loan to buy more clothes in order to make more profits. 

In the future, she hopes to sell a variety of second-hand clothes and more sweat suits so that many clients could buy different clothes from her. She wishes to make enough savings for her children and take them to good schools.

loans.use: Buying used clothes

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a mother of one child, Hala and her husband Ibrahim has a small farm in Hebron where they raise sheep and sell them. Hala and her husband started this business six years ago. Hala came to FATEN and took a $1500 loan to purchase feed for the sheep they raise.
This is the second loan they have taken from FATEN. Hala and her husband were very good borrowers who repaid their first loan on time.
Hala’s husband appears in the picture here with their child as she is religious and doesn’t want her picture online.

loans.use: Purchase feeds

loans.name: Los Claveles Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario LOS CLAVELES  esta compuesta por tres integrantes  todas mujeres,   La   representante del grupo es la Sra. la representante del grupo es la Sra. Jiovana  tiene un hijo D. 4 años  que no asiste todavía a la escuela, su actividad D. la Sra. Es la venta D. Papa y el destino del crédito es para la compra D. Papa por cantidad, lleva ya 3 años en esta actividad, todas ellas viven en rodeo  km. 33 carretera a Santa Cruz , en la zona son muy conocidas  por ser personas muy responsables y trabajadoras,  ellas se dedican a la venta D. Papa los días D. feria en sacaba , Cochabamba ,Tiraque y una D. ellas se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos el préstamo lo destinaran para aumentar su mercadería .
texts.en:
The "Los Claves" ["The Carnations"] solidarity group is composed of three members, all women.  The group representative is Ms. Jiovana.  She has a four year-old son who is not yet in school.  Her business is selling potatoes and she will use this loan to buy potatoes in large quantities.  She has been doing this for three years.

All of the women live around 33 kilometers by highway from Santa Cruz.  In their area, they are well known for being very responsible and hard working people.  They sell potatoes on market days in Sacaba, Cochabamba, and Tiraque.  One of them sells cosmetics.  She will use the loan to add to her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in large quantities

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique B. está renovando su credikiva para comprar artículos deportivos y de contado, aumentar el surtido de su negocio y despertar el interés de sus clientes  en su oferta. El credikiva anterior le ha permitido no acudir a prestamistas con altos intereses  por eso esta ganando mas dinero cada vez que vende un articulo. Siempre su esposa y él estan unidos en todo,  por eso aperecen juntos en la fotografia.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Luis Enrique haga clip en el siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/189076
texts.en:
Luis Enrique B. is renewing his Kiva loan to buy sporting goods in cash, to increase his business' stock and to stir up his customers' interest in what he has to offer.  His previous Kiva loan allowed him to steer clear of moneylenders with high interest rates.  This has meant that he has makes more money each time he sells something.  He and his wife are united in everything, for this reason they appear together in the photograph.

If you would like to know more about Luis Enrique's story, follow this link:
http://kiva.org/lend/189076

loans.use: To buy sporting goods wholesale and in cash

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
